350.description: Creates Patient Compensation System Trust Fund; provides for purpose & sources of funds of trust fund; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund; provides for contingent effect.

351.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 708 (Ch. 2014-86), CS/CS/HB 633 (Ch. 2014-123)
351.title: Property Insurance
351.description: Provides that claim for residential property insurance cannot be denied based on certain credit information; provides that policy or contract may not be cancelled based on certain credit information; revises rule requirements relating to property insurance mediation program administered by DFS; provides grounds for challenging umpire's impartiality in estimating amount of property loss; redefines term "neutral evaluator"; specifies grounds for denying, suspending, or revoking approval of neutral evaluator; establishes Homeowner Claims Bill of Rights for personal lines residential property insurance policyholders; provides that such bill of rights does not provide cause of action; defines terms; provides requirements for emergency mitigation repair agreements; requires emergency mitigation contractor to be appropriately certified or to possess contracting license.

352.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 702 (Ch. 2014-85)
352.title: Pharmacy Audits
352.description: Provides rights to which licensed pharmacy is entitled during certain audits by specified entities; provides for applicability; provides exemption from notice requirements for entity that audits certain pharmacy.

353.title: Education Funding
353.description: Provides for calculation of additional FTE student membership based on enrollment in Advancement Via Individual Determination elective classes & examination scores; provides for use of funds.

354.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 398 (Ch. 2014-179)
354.title: Florida Tourism Hall of Fame
354.description: Establishes Florida Tourism Hall of Fame; provides for administration by Florida Tourism Industry Marketing Corporation; designates location for display of inductee plaques; provides procedures for nomination, selection, & induction of members; provides that person inducted before certain date remains in Hall of Fame.

355.last_action: Died in Health and Human Services Committee
355.title: Telehealth
355.description: Provides practice standards for telehealth providers; requires registration of health care professionals before they may use telehealth to deliver health care services; prohibits registrants from opening an office or providing in-person health care services in this state; requires registrant to notify appropriate board or DOH of certain actions against registrant's professional license; prohibits health care professional with revoked license from being registered as telehealth provider; provides exemptions.

356.title: School Safety
356.description: Permits school superintendent, with approval of the school board, to authorize school safety designee to carry concealed weapon or firearm on school property; provides requirements for school safety designees; provides exception to prohibition on possession of firearms or other specified devices on school property or other specified areas; provides for fingerprint processing & retention; requires that fees be borne by school safety designee or school; requires school boards to formulate policies & procedures for dealing with active shooters & hostage situations in consultation with law enforcement; requires district school boards & private schools allow campus tours by local law enforcement agencies for specified purposes & that their recommendations be documented; permits district school boards to commission one or more school safety officers on each school campus.

357.title: Courts
357.description: Provides for consideration of time-sharing schedules or time-sharing arrangements as factor in adjustment of awards of child support; authorizes judges in family cases to take judicial notice of certain court records without prior notice to parties in certain circumstances; provides for deferred opportunity to present evidence; requires notice of taking such judicial notice to be filed within specified period; provides that term "family cases" has same meaning as provided in Rules of Judicial Administration; creates an exception to prohibition against using evidence other than verified pleading or affidavit in an ex parte hearing for temporary injunction for protection against domestic violence, repeat violence, sexual violence, dating violence, or stalking.

358.title: Estates
358.description: Specifies that certain restrictions on gifts to lawyers & certain other people apply to written instruments executed after date certain; providing applicability; provides circumstances under which burden of proof shifts in cases involving undue influence; provides retroactive application; requires that directive to apply certain death benefits for payment of claims & administration expenses be specified in certain instruments; provides for retroactive applicability; establishes which party bears burden of proof in action to contest validity or revocation of trust; provides changes apply after date certain; requires specific directive for certain assets & death benefits to be used to pay estate expenses; provides for retroactive applicability; provides for vesting of outright devises in certain trust documents; provides applicability.

359.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 633 (Ch. 2014-123), CS/CS/SB 708 (Ch. 2014-86)
359.title: Insurance Claims
359.description: Adds mediators & neutral evaluators to list of individuals or entities that DFS or OIR may investigate for alleged improper conduct; provides that claim for residential property insurance cannot be denied based on certain credit information; providing that policy or contract be cancelled based on certain credit information; provides for assignment of property insurance policy benefits; specifies requirements for assignment of post-loss benefits in valid agreement for services; revises rule requirements relating to property insurance mediation program; provides grounds for challenging an umpire's impartiality; redefines term "neutral evaluator"; specifies grounds for denying, suspending, or revoking approval of neutral evaluator; establishes Claims Bill of Rights for residential property insurance policyholders; provides that such bill of rights does not provide cause of action; provides requirements for emergency mitigation repair agreements; revises qualifications for mediators of personal injury claims; provides grounds for denying, suspending, or revoking application or approval of mediator.

360.title: State Speed Zones
360.description: Specifies DOT authority to determine certain minimum speed limits; & revises maximum allowable speed limit on certain roadways under jurisdiction of DOT.

361.last_action: Died in Veteran and Military Affairs Subcommittee
361.title: Fee and Toll Waivers for Purple Heart Recipients
361.description: Provides that Purple Heart recipient is eligible to receive lifetime family annual entrance pass to state parks at no charge; requires DOT to establish prepaid toll account for eligible Purple Heart recipients; authorizes Purple Heart recipient to apply for account; requires applicant to provide specified documentation to department.

362.title: Pharmacy Benefit Managers
362.description: Specifies contract terms that must be included in contract between pharmacy benefit manager & pharmacy; provides restrictions on inclusion of prescriptions drugs on list that specifies maximum allowable cost for such drugs; requires pharmacy benefit manager to disclose certain information to plan sponsor; requires contract between pharmacy benefit manager & pharmacy to include appeal process; requires pharmacy benefit manager to contractually commit to providing certain reimbursement rate for generic drugs.

363.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee
363.title: Business Entities
363.description: Revises fees for LLC, corporation for profit, corporation not for profit, limited partnership, & partnership; provides fees for filing initial registered agent designation & for filing articles of revocation of dissolution; repeals annual supplemental corporate fee; requires business entity to pay late fee for filing annual report after certain dates; provides exception.

364.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5601 (Ch. 2014-38)
364.title: Energy-efficient Appliances/Sales Tax Holiday
364.description: Defines "energy-efficient appliance"; provides sales tax exemption for sale of certain energy-efficient appliances during specified month each year; provides exceptions; authorizes DOR to adopt rules.

365.title: Secondary Metals Recyclers
365.description: Transfers administration of provisions relating to secondary metals recyclers from DOR to DOACS; authorizes DOR to share certain confidential information with DOACS; revises application requirements for registration as secondary metals recycler; requires secondary metals recyclers to maintain specified insurance coverage; requires secondary metals recyclers to exhibit active registration certificates from DOACS before applying for or renewing local business tax receipt; requires secondary metals recyclers to allow DOACS personnel to enter certain places of business for specified purpose; revises penalties for noncompliance; requires DOACS to suspend certain registrations or applications for registration under certain circumstances; prohibits secondary metals recyclers from purchasing regulated metals property, restricted regulated metals property, or ferrous metals on Sundays.

366.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-128, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 775 (Ch. 2014-129)
366.title: Pugilistic Exhibitions
366.description: Revises provisions related to pugilistic exhibitions.

367.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-129, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 773 (Ch. 2014-128)
367.title: Pub. Rec./Florida State Boxing Commission
367.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for proprietary confidential business information in reports required to be filed with Florida State Boxing Commission by promoter or obtained by commission through audit of promoter's records; defines term "proprietary confidential business information"; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

368.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
368.title: Santa Rosa Island Authority, Escambia County
368.description: Revises expense allowance for authority members.

369.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
369.title: Urban High-Crime Area Job Tax Credit Program
369.description: Provides for repeal of Urban High-Crime Area Job Tax Credit Program; provides that certain tax credits may be carried forward; provides for repeal of certain tax credits.

370.title: Legal Notices
370.description: Requires legal notices to be posted on newspaper's website on web pages with specified titles; prohibits charging fee or requiring registration for viewing online legal notices; establishing period for which legal notices are required to be published on statewide website; requires that legal notices be archived on statewide website for specified period; deletes provision relating to harmless error; clarifies payment provisions.

371.title: Motor Vehicle Sales
371.description: Prohibits affiliated finance company from taking specified actions relating to certain finance obligations arising from vehicle contract that contains third-party provider's specified automotive related product; provides factors to determine whether automotive related product is similar in nature, scope, & quality to automotive related product offered for sale by affiliated finance company or its related manufacturer or wholesale distributor; provides that violation does not constitute criminal offense.

373.title: Nursing Home Guide Watch List
373.description: Requires nursing home facility on Nursing Home Guide Watch List to post signs containing certain information for specified period; specifies contents & location of signs; provides sanctions for failure to comply; requires facility on watch list to provide notice containing certain information to resident's primary familial contact.

374.title: Rights Of Grandparents And Great-Grandparents
374.description: Authorizes grandparent of minor child to petition court for visitation; requires preliminary hearing; provides for payment of attorney fees & costs by petitioner who fails to make prima facie showing of harm; provides for application of Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction & Enforcement Act; provides conditions under which court may terminate grandparent visitation order upon adoption of minor child by stepparent or close relative; provides for great-grandparent's right to notice of adoption.

375.last_action: Died in returning Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7093 (Ch. 2014-151)
375.title: Coastal Management
375.description: Revises coastal construction & excavation permit requirements; authorizes DEP, in consultation with FWCC, to grant areawide permits for certain structures; requires DEP to adopt rules; requires DEP to promote public use of aquatic preserves & uplands; authorizes DEP to grant certain privileges & concessions & to receive funds for specified purposes; requires DEP to post descriptions of such privileges & concessions & provide for public comment on agreements for such privileges & concessions.

376.title: Community Development Districts
376.description: Provides for dissolution of certain community development districts by majority vote of landowners; provides procedures for calling meeting of district landowners & conducting vote on dissolution of district; provides for notice & effect of dissolution & repeal of certain rules.

377.title: Student Discipline
377.description: Requires school districts to adopt standards for intervention rather than code of student conduct; revises qualifications & duties of school resource officer & school safety officer; requires school district policy on referrals to criminal justice or juvenile justice system; requires cooperative agreements with law enforcement agencies; requires use of alternatives to expulsion or referral to law enforcement agencies except in certain instances.

378.title: Clerks of Court
378.description: Authorizes jurors & witnesses to be paid by check; requires party applying for garnishment to pay deposit to garnishee, rather than in registry of court; deletes provision that requires clerk to collect specified fee; provides requirements for sale of tax certificates; revises requirements for redemption of tax certificates; provides circumstances under which land shall be placed on specified list; clarifies notice requirements; provides for excess proceeds relating to unclaimed property; requires clerk to ensure that excess funds are paid according to specified priorities; provides for interpleader actions & award of reasonable fees & costs.

379.last_action: Died in Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
379.title: Transitional Living Facilities
379.description: Creates part XI, ch. 400, F.S., relating to transitional living facilities; provides requirements with respect to licensure, policies & procedures, client admission & care, screening of employees, recordkeeping, & safekeeping of client property & funds; provides penalties for violations.

380.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
380.title: Local Government Construction Preferences
380.description: Prohibits local ordinances & regulations from restricting a certified contractor's competition for award of contract for construction services based upon certain conditions; requires state college, school district, or other political subdivision to make specified disclosures in competitive solicitation documents; provides applicability.

381.title: Communications Services Tax
381.description: Revises definition of term "information service" to include certain data processing & other services for purposes of communications services tax; provides retroactive applicability & construction.

382.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-132, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 321 (Ch. 2014-112), HB 5601 (Ch. 2014-38)
382.title: Title Insurer Reserves
382.description: Revising criteria with respect to liabilities charged against assets in determinations of financial condition; specifying the reserves certain title insurers must set aside after a certain date; revising provisions relating to premium taxes paid by insurers; requiring certified title insurers to add a specified number of jobs within a certain time, etc.

383.title: Residential Properties
383.description: Providing that timeshare projects are not subject to annual inspection requirements; providing that a condominium association that does not own any units classified as timeshare projects is not required to apply for or receive a public lodging establishment license; providing that timeshare projects within separate buildings or at separate locations but managed by one licensed agent may be combined in a single license application; authorizing an association to inspect and repair abandoned condominium units; defining the term "previous owner" for purposes of provisions relating to the liability of condominium unit owners for assessments, etc.

384.title: Manatee County
384.description: Repeals special acts relating to Manatee County Law Library, certain license & court fees collected for use by library, Manatee County Law Library Committee, and law librarian.

385.title: Foreign Investments
385.description: Revising the percentage of investments that the State Board of Administration may invest in foreign securities; revising and providing definitions with respect to requirements that the board divest securities in which public moneys are invested in certain companies doing specified types of business in or with Sudan or Iran; requiring a domestic insurer to provide a list of investments that it has in companies on the State Board of Administration's lists of scrutinized companies with activities in Sudan or in Iran's petroleum energy sector, etc.

386.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
386.title: Water and Wastewater Utilities
386.description: Designates act as "Ratepayer Representation Act"; prohibits county from providing water or sewer services in unincorporated areas covered by agreement with municipality; authorizes county to services when agreement does not provide expiration date; specifies that corporate powers of municipality do not apply to unincorporated areas of county without county's express consent; limits amount of water & sewer utility rates, fees, charges, & surcharges that municipality may impose on consumers outside of municipality's boundaries or ratepayers in unincorporated areas of county; requires PSC approval of such rates, fees, charges, & surcharges; authorizes ratepayers in unincorporated areas to petition PSC for determination whether rates, fees, & charges imposed by municipality are just & equitable; provides that PSC has regulatory authority over municipality that provides water or wastewater utility service in unincorporated areas of county; requires PSC approval before municipality purchases certain water or wastewater facilities.

387.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5601 (Ch. 2014-38)
387.title: Tax on Sales, Use, and Other Transactions
387.description: Expands sales & use tax exemption to include school lunches served by colleges & universities.

388.title: City of Cocoa, Brevard County
388.description: Annexing Pinecrest Cemetery & Evergreen Memorial Park into city.

389.last_action: Died in Health Policy, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 97 (Ch. 2014-108)
389.title: Department of Health
389.description: Authorizes DHSMV to provide reproductions of specified records to DOH; specifies notification & consent procedures for performing HIV test in health care setting & nonhealth care setting; provides that member of public may not be charged for certain examinations, investigations, or autopsies; clarifies DOH duties to maintain confidentiality of certain patient records; authorizes licensees under investigation to inspect or receive copies of certain patient records; revises certain fees & rates; revises certain continuing education requirements for Board of Medicine licensees; revises provisions related to professions including certified nursing assistants, dental laboratory operators, midwives, registered dietitians, nursing home administrators, & massage therapy apprentices; requires health care provider to continue to be agent for specified period after ineligibility.

391.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
391.title: City of Panacea, Wakulla County
391.description: Creates City of Panacea within Wakulla County; creates city charter; provides for council-manager form of government; provides for five-member city council; provides for referendum.

392.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee
392.title: Renewable Energy Source Devices
392.description: Prohibits consideration by property appraisers of increased value of real property due to installation of renewable energy source devices by end use customers; revises definition of term "renewable energy source device"; provides for applicability; provides for contingent effect.

393.title: Involuntary Examinations under the Baker Act
393.description: Reordering & providing definitions; updating references to DCF; authorizes physician assistants & advanced registered nurse practitioners to initiate involuntary examinations under Baker Act of persons believed to have mental illness; provides education & continuing education requirements for such physician assistants & advanced registered nurse practitioners.

394.last_action: Withdrawn prior to introduction, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 670 (Ch. 2014-83)
394.title: Nursing Home Records
394.description: Requires nursing home to provide copy of resident's paper & electronic records upon receipt of written request that meets certain federal requirements; requires facility to furnish resident's records within certain timeframe; authorizes certain persons to make request for deceased resident's records; requires that request for deceased resident's records be in writing & meet certain federal requirements; specifies certain documentation that must accompany request for deceased resident's records; authorizes facility to refuse to furnish records; provides that facility is not criminally or civilly liable for furnishing resident's records.

395.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
395.title: Specialty License Plates/Florida Homebuilders
395.description: Directs DHSMV to create Florida Homebuilders license plate; establishes annual use fee for plate; & provides for distribution of use fees received from sale of such plates.

396.title: Commission on Federalism
396.description: Creates Commission on Federalism; provides duties of commission to evaluate federal laws for adherence to U.S. Constitution & principle of federalism; authorizes commission to issue determinations regarding constitutional authority for evaluated laws; requires commission to monitor & communicate with other states on certain actions taken pursuant to Article V of U.S. Constitution; requires commission to submit annual report to Governor & Legislature.

397.title: Mental Health Treatment
397.description: Authorizes forensic & civil facilities to order continuation of psychotherapeutics for individuals receiving such medications in jail before admission; provides timeframes within which status hearings must be held; revises time for dismissal of certain charges for defendants that remain incompetent to proceed to trial; provides exceptions; provides timeframe within which status hearings must be held.

399.title: Crime Stoppers Trust Fund
399.description: Authorizes county that is awarded funds from trust fund to use the funds for promotional items.

400.last_action: Died pending review of CS, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1030 (Ch. 2014-157), SB 1700 (Ch. 2014-158)
400.title: Cannabis
400.description: Authorizes specified physicians to order low-THC cannabis for use by specified patients; provides conditions; prohibits specified acts by physicians or persons seeking low-THC cannabis; requires physician education; requires DOH to create compassionate use registry & authorize specified number of dispensing organizations; authorizes certain medical centers to conduct research on cannabidiol & low-THC cannabis; requires DOH to establish Office of Compassionate Use; authorizes state universities with both medical & agricultural programs to conduct specified research on cannabidiol & low-THC cannabis; authorizes use of research funds for such research.

401.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee
401.title: Original Works of Art
401.description: Exempts certain original works of art from sales & use tax; defines term "original works of art."

402.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5601 (Ch. 2014-38)
402.title: Taxes on Prepaid Calling Arrangements
402.description: Revises definition of "prepaid calling arrangement" to clarify & update which services are included under that definition & subject to sales tax; provides for retroactive application.

403.title: Service Animals
403.description: Requires public accommodation to permit use of service animal by individual with disability; provides conditions for public accommodation to exclude or remove service animal; revises penalties to include community service for certain persons or entities who interfere with use of service animal; provides penalty for knowing & willful misrepresentation with respect to use or training of service animal.

404.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-62, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7015 (Ch. 2014-1)
404.title: Postsecondary Education Tuition and Fees
404.description: Revising the definition of the term "tuition differential"; revising the purchase date of an advance payment contract as it relates to the amount paid by the Florida Prepaid College Board to a state university on behalf of a qualified beneficiary; revising the standard tuition and out-of-state fee for certain workforce education postsecondary programs and certain programs at Florida College System institutions; revising state university resident undergraduate tuition; providing for the waiver of out-of-state fees for students based on certain attendance, graduation, and enrollment requirements; prohibiting denial of classification as a resident for tuition purposes based on certain immigration status, etc.

405.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5601 (Ch. 2014-38)
405.title: Tax Credits or Refunds
405.description: Provides procedures, requirements, & calculation methodologies that allow dealers to obtain tax credits or refunds for taxes paid on worthless or uncollectable private-label credit card or dealer credit accounts or receivables; provides limitations on amount that may be recovered; provides definitions.

406.title: Inspectors General
406.description: Requires Chief Inspector General to publish final investigative reports in specified manner within certain timeframe; requires final investigative reports of inspectors general to be published on an agency website within certain timeframe; requires certain reports of local governments to be published online within certain timeframe.

408.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1030 (Ch. 2014-157)
408.title: Medical Use Of Cannabis
408.description: Authorizes qualifying patient to possess & administer medical cannabis, & possess & use paraphernalia for specified purpose; authorizes patient's caregiver to possess & administer medical cannabis to qualifying patient & to possess & use paraphernalia for specified purpose; provides procedures & requirements thereto; provides that act does not allow person to undertake task under influence of medical cannabis when doing so constitutes negligence or malpractice; provides that use of medical cannabis does not create defense to certain offenses; authorizes physician to recommend use of medical cannabis; provides procedures & requirements thereto; requires DBPR to regulate licensure of cultivation centers & dispensaries; provides procedures & requirements thereto; prohibits school, employer, or property owner from refusing to enroll, employ, or lease to or penalize person who is cardholder; requires DOH, DBPR, & DOR to adopt rules by specified date; establishing medical cannabis section within DBPR; provides procedures & requirements; authorizes medical cannabis farm to possess, cultivate, & manufacture medical cannabis, medical cannabis-based products, & marijuana plants for wholesale in this state; requires agricultural classification for land used as medical cannabis farm; prohibits medical cannabis farm from conducting retail sales or transactions; provides certain protections to medical cannabis farms; provides permitting procedures and fees; provides licensing procedures and fees; requires reporting of loss, theft, or unexplained shortage of medical cannabis product to local law enforcement agency & department; authorizes administrative fines, license suspension, injunctive relief.

409.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
409.title: Municipal Power Regulation
409.description: Amends definition of "public utility" to include municipalities that purchase or receive power from entity created under Florida Interlocal Cooperation Act of 1969; amends definition of "electric utility" to exempt municipalities that purchase or receive power from entity created under Florida Interlocal Cooperation Act of 1969 .

410.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-212, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 865 (Ch. 2014-213)
410.title: Motor Vehicle Crash Reports
410.description: Specifies that required statement must be completed & sworn to for each confidential crash report requested.

411.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-213, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 863 (Ch. 2014-212)
411.title: Pub. Rec./Motor Vehicle Crash Reports
411.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for certain personal contact information contained in motor vehicle crash reports.

412.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
412.title: Specialty License Plates/Play Ball
412.description: Requires DHSMV to create Play Ball license plate; establishes annual use fee for plate; provides for distribution of use fees received from sale of such plates.

413.last_action: Died in Select Committee on PPACA, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 97 (Ch. 2014-108), CS/SB 86 (Ch. 2014-64)
413.title: Health Care
413.description: Revises Florida Healthy Kids Corporation Act to include Healthy Florida program; prohibits cause of action from arising against Florida Healthy Kids Corporation for failure to make health services available; revises eligibility of Medikids program component; revises certain minimum health benefits coverage under Florida Kidcare; revises duties of DCF & AHCA with regard to Kidcare program; creates Healthy Florida program.

415.last_action: Died in Economic Affairs Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7015 (Ch. 2014-1)
415.title: Employment of Veterans
415.description: Authorizes private employers to provide employment preference for certain persons.

416.title: Education Fiscal Accountability
416.description: Requires school report cards to include school & school district return-on-investment (ROI) ratings; requires Commissioner of Education to establish ROI index to evaluate extent to which schools & school districts are using financial resources to improve student performance; requires commissioner to assign & publish ROI ratings; creates Schoolhouse Funding Pilot Program subject to annual appropriation; provides requirements for pilot school participating in program.

417.last_action: Died in Business and Professional Regulation Subcommittee
417.title: Package Stores
417.description: Repeals provisions relating to restrictions on sale by certain licensed alcoholic beverage vendors of merchandise other than specifically authorized types of merchandise & restrictions on direct access to such vendor's place of business; conforms provisions; defines "package store"; prohibits EBT cards from being used or accepted at locations operated as a package store.

420.last_action: Died in Transportation, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7005 (Ch. 2014-216)
420.title: License Plates
420.description: Revises provisions for DHSMV to withhold renewal of registration or replacement registration of motor vehicle; revises conditions under which revalidation sticker or replacement license plate may be issued; prohibits DHSMV from issuing license plate, revalidation sticker, or replacement license plate for vehicle or vessel identified in notice from lienor; revises procedures for dispute of notice to surrender vehicle or vessel; authorizes civil actions & award of attorney fees & costs.

422.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
422.title: Professional Sports Franchises
422.description: Redefines term "league" to include Major League Soccer; prohibits certain previously certified applicants from receiving additional certification for certain franchises or facilities; increases number of facilities that DEO may certify as facility for a new or retained professional sports franchise; requires DEO to reserve two facility certifications for new Major League Soccer franchises.

423.title: Law Enforcement & Correctional Officers
423.description: Specifies applicability of law enforcement & correctional officers' rights to include internal or external complaints against an officer.

424.title: Pub. Rec./Dismissed Petitions for Protective Injunctions for Repeat Violence
424.description: Exempts from public records requirements protective injunction for repeat violence that has been dismissed & petition's contents; provides for removal of petitions dismissed before effective date of act; provides statement of public necessity.

425.title: Teacher Evaluations
425.description: Prohibits student's learning growth data from being used in calculating student learning growth portion of classroom teacher's evaluation under certain circumstances.

426.last_action: Died in K-12 Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7031 (Ch. 2014-39), CS/SB 1642 (Ch. 2014-23)
426.title: State Assessments
426.description: Designates act as "Ethan Rediske Act"; revises provisions relating to waiver of assessment results for certain students with disabilities; establishes eligibility criteria for assessment of students with disabilities.

428.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5601 (Ch. 2014-38)
428.title: Electrical Power or Energy
428.description: Imposes additional tax on gross receipts for electrical power or energy for specified years; revises exemptions from tax on gross receipts for utility & communications services; provides exemptions from additional tax on gross receipts from electrical power or energy; requires additional tax to be excluded from taxable base on which gross receipts are calculated under certain circumstances; revises sales tax rate for charges for electrical power or energy; provides that discretionary sales surtaxes apply regardless of sales tax rate for charges for electrical power or energy; requires discretionary sales surtaxes to be levied on all charges for electrical power or energy unless specifically exempted; provides for sales tax holiday for certain products; provides restrictions; authorizes emergency rules.

429.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
429.title: Ad Valorem Taxes and Non-Ad Valorem Assessments Against Subdivision Property
429.description: Provides for assessment of ad valorem taxes & non-ad valorem assessments against certain common elements of subdivision; prohibits such common elements from being prorated by property appraiser & included in assessment of lots within subdivision.

430.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 386 (Ch. 2014-10)
430.title: Application of Foreign Law in Certain Cases
430.description: Defines "foreign law, legal code, or system"; specifies public policy on application of foreign law, legal code, or system in proceedings relating to dissolution of marriage, support, time-sharing, UCCJEA, & UIFSA; provides that certain decisions rendered under such laws, codes, or systems are void; provides that certain contracts & contract provisions are void; provides for construction of waiver by natural person of person's fundamental liberties, rights, & privileges guaranteed by state or federal constitutions; provides that claims of forum non conveniens or related claims must be denied; provides that act doesn't require or authorize court to adjudicate, or prohibit any religious organization from adjudicating, ecclesiastical matters in violation of specified constitutional provisions or to conflict with any federal treaty or other international agreement to which U.S. is party to specified extent.

433.title: Florida Mission Readiness Commission
433.description: Creates Florida Mission Readiness Commission to assess readiness of infants, children, teens, & young adults to grow up to meet challenges of adulthood; requires commission to recommend public policy initiatives that increase preparedness of state's youth to enable them to fulfill their highest potential; assigns commission to DOH for administrative purposes.

434.title: City of Panama City, Bay County
434.description: Authorizes certain sales of alcoholic beverages for consumption off-premises at specified events in certain areas.

435.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
435.title: Bay County Medical Center, Bay County
435.description: Provides that pension plan is irrevocable trust; provides for control of plan.

436.title: Board of Trustees of Bay Medical Center, Bay County
436.description: Amends ch. 2005-343, Laws of Florida; provides for removal of certain board member.

438.title: Bay County Tourist Development Council, Bay County
438.description: Revises membership of council; provides exception to general law.

439.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 864 (Ch. 2014-15)
439.title: Instructional Materials for K-12 Public Education
439.description: Provides requirements for school district instructional materials program; provides criteria for review, recommendation, & adoption of instructional materials; authorizes district school board to use all of instructional materials annual allocation for purchase of certain digital or electronic instructional materials.

440.title: Regulation of Summer Camps
440.description: Requires summer camp personnel & volunteers to display identification badge issued by DCF; requires background screening of camp personnel & volunteers; provides duties of department.

441.last_action: Died in Business and Professional Regulation Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7005 (Ch. 2014-216)
441.title: Recreational Vehicle Dealer
441.description: Provides requirements for licensed recreational vehicle dealers to hold certain off-premises sales; requires dealer to notify local DHSMV office.

442.title: Little Gasparilla Island, Charlotte County
442.description: Permits modifications to certain docks; provides exception to general law.

443.title: West Palm Beach Firefighters Pension Fund
443.description: Extends period in which funds received under ch. 175, F.S., shall be used to reduce employee contributions to West Palm Beach Firefighters Pension Fund; clarifies that such funds are not refundable as employee contributions; authorizes vested members to request refund of contributions in lieu of benefit; requires payment of certain benefits to designated beneficiary; clarifies requirement for certain members to take lump sum distribution of their entire lump sum accumulated sick leave & vacation leave within specified time after their termination of employment in certain circumstances; reduces actuarial assumed rate of return.

444.last_action: Died in Select Committee on Gaming
444.title: Greyhound Racing Injuries
444.description: Directs DBPR's Division of Pari-mutuel Wagering to maintain records of greyhounds injured while racing; provides for content of such records; provides penalties for making false statements on injury form.

445.title: Adult Day Care Centers
445.description: Revises exemptions from licensure & regulation; provides for operation of adult day care center in temporary location under certain conditions; provides notification requirements when center relocates; authorizes AHCA to grant conditional license to centers that relocate; provides license renewal & inspection requirements; adds ground for agency action against owner of center or its operator or employee; revises staff training requirements; requires center to notify agency before proceeding with building alterations.

447.last_action: Died in Banking and Insurance, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5601 (Ch. 2014-38)
447.title: Bail Bond Premiums
447.description: Repeals provision separating calculation of insurance premium taxes from financial reporting for bail bond premiums; specifies amount of direct written premiums for bail bonds for purpose of calculation of certain taxes.

448.title: Instructional Materials
448.description: Revises provisions relating to district school board use of annual allocation for purchase of instructional materials.

449.title: Department of Revenue's Certified Audit Program
449.description: Revises amounts of interest liability that DOR may abate for taxpayers participating in certified audit program; authorizes taxpayer to participate in certified audit program after DOR has issued notice of intent to conduct audit of taxpayer; reduces amount of interest that may be abated for taxpayer requesting to participate in program; specifies tax programs to be audited; revises procedures, deadlines, & notice requirements for certified audits; authorizes DOR to adopt rules prohibiting qualified practitioner from representing taxpayer in informal conference procedures under certain circumstances.

450.last_action: Died in Select Committee on Gaming
450.title: Amusement Machines
450.description: Revises provisions for operation of certain amusement games & machines; revises applicability; revises provisions limiting per game cost of merchandise received by player; requires DOR to publish amount of adjusted limit; repeals provisions relating to injunction to restrain violation.

451.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1070 (Ch. 2014-93)
451.title: Fuel Terminals
451.description: Provides legislative intent; provides definitions; prohibits local government from amending its comprehensive plan, land use map, zoning districts, or land development regulations to make fuel terminals nonconforming use under provisions thereof; provides for repair of fuel terminal to its preexisting capacity after certain events; provides applicability.

452.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-239, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 951 (Ch. 2014-240)
452.title: East Naples Fire Control Rescue District, Collier County
452.description: Revises district boundaries for purposes of annexing Isles of Capri Fire & Rescue District into district; requires referendum.

453.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-240, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 949 (Ch. 2014-239)
453.title: Collier County
453.description: Merges East Naples Fire Control & Rescue District & Golden Gate Fire Control & Rescue District, Collier County, to create new district; creates & establishes independent special fire control district to be known as Greater Naples Fire Rescue District; provides that district is independent special district; provides legislative intent; provides for applicability of chapters 191 & 189, F.S., & other general laws; provides district charter; provides boundaries; provides for district board; creates exception to general law; provides authority of board; provides for staff; provides duties & powers of board; provides for elections to board; provides for salaries of board members; provides for removal of board members; provides savings clause for existing district authority to levy up to 1.5 mills; provides for bonds; provides for raising of revenue; provides for taxation; provides findings; provides for impact fees; provides for collection & disbursement of such fees; provides for deposit of taxes, assessments, & fees & authority to disburse funds; provides for immunity from tort liability; provides for liberal construction; provides for severability; provides that this act shall take precedence over any conflicting law to extent of such conflict; provides for determination of millage; repeals chapters 2000-392, 2012-231, 2004-433, & 2000-444, LOF, relating to East Naples Fire Control & Rescue District & Golden Gate Fire Control & Rescue District; transfers all assets & liabilities of existing districts to Greater Naples Fire Rescue District; requires referendum.

454.title: State Contracting
454.description: Revises criteria for evaluating proposal to include consideration of prior relevant experience of vendor; revising criteria for evaluating response to agency's invitation to negotiate to include consideration of prior relevant experience of vendor.

455.title: Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission
455.description: Revises provisions relating to hunting & fishing licenses, permits, & authorizations, boating safety courses, & use of moneys collected from vessel registration fees; repeals provisions relating to cooperative agreements with U.S. Forest Service, certain spiny lobster licenses, gear license fees, & certain haul seine & trawl permits.

456.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
456.title: Local Regulation of Wage Theft
456.description: Provides requirements for county ordinances regulating wage theft; authorizes county funding to assist in addressing claims of wage theft; preempts further regulation of wage theft to state; provides exception.

457.title: Health Care Clinic Act
457.description: Provides that clinic employing physician whose license is suspended or revoked is subject to administrative & criminal penalties.

458.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
458.title: Dual Enrollment
458.description: Authorizes Florida College System institution board of trustees & president to establish dual enrollment articulation agreement with any district school superintendent; authorizes Florida College System institution to serve secondary dual enrollment students who reside outside institution's service area & state universities to serve students who reside anywhere in state; revises provisions relating to FTE student membership value for dual enrollment students & provisions delineating costs incurred in providing dual enrollment.

459.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
459.title: Use of State Funds in Support of Boycotts
459.description: Provides findings & intent; defines terms "academic entity," "host country," & "public postsecondary education institution"; prohibits use of state funds to fund academic entities that promote discriminatory boycotts; provides limitations.

461.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 89 (Ch. 2014-195)
461.title: Mandatory Minimum Sentencing
461.description: Authorizes judge to impose sentence below mandatory minimum sentence; requires judge to state in writing reasons for departing from or using mandatory minimum sentence; provides factors that judge must consider in deciding whether to depart from mandatory minimum sentence.

462.title: Employee Health Care Access Act
462.description: Revises definition of term "eligible employee" for whom the Employee Health Care Access Act provides for availability of access to certain health insurance coverage.

463.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
463.title: Specialty License Plates/Bonefish & Tarpon Trust
463.description: Directs DHSMV to create Bonefish & Tarpon Trust license plate.

464.title: Transportation Services Procurement
464.description: Requires agency to consider certain criteria when evaluating RFP or ITN for specified transportation services.

465.title: Administrative Procedures
465.description: Requires that final order in specified administrative proceedings award all reasonable costs & attorney fees to prevailing party; revises criteria used by administrative law judge to determine if party participated in proceeding for improper purpose; authorizes recovery of reasonable attorney fees & costs incurred in litigating entitlement to or quantification of attorney's fees & costs.

466.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-166, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1666 (Ch. 2014-224)
466.title: Motor Vehicle Insurance & Driver Education for Children in Care
466.description: Authorizing the court to consider the best interest of a child in removing specified disabilities of nonage for certain minors; directing the Department of Children and Families to establish a statewide pilot program to pay specified costs of driver education, licensure and costs incidental to licensure, and motor vehicle insurance for a child in licensed out-of-home care who meets certain qualifications; removing the disability of nonage of minors for purposes of obtaining motor vehicle insurance; providing for preferential enrollment in driver education for specified children in care; providing an appropriation, etc.

467.title: Homelessness
467.description: Revises legislative findings; requires DEO to provide training & technical assistance to certain designated lead agencies of homeless assistance continuums of care; requires that provision of such training & assistance be delegated to certain nonprofit entities; requires department to establish award levels for "Challenge Grants"; specifies criteria to determine award levels; requires department, after consultation with Council on Homelessness, to specify grant award level in notice of solicitation of grant applications; revises qualifications for grant; specifies authorized uses of grant funds; requires lead agency that receives grant to submit report to department; provides for contingent effect.

468.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
468.title: Dual Enrollment Program
468.description: Exempts dual enrollment students from paying technology fees; revises provisions relating to home education students participating in dual enrollment program; authorizes instructional materials to be free of charge to students; provides requirements for private school student to participate in dual enrollment program; revises provisions relating to dual enrollment articulation agreements.

469.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
469.title: Entertainment Industry Financial Incentive Program
469.description: Revises purpose of program; revises application requirements & approval procedure for tax credits; requires certified productions to notify Office of Film & Entertainment of changes to certain production circumstances; requires office to deem certain tax credit awards denied & applications withdrawn; authorizes office to approve adjusted tax credit awards under certain circumstances; provides that certified production is not entitled to tax credit award unless certified production's actual qualified expenditures have been verified by office & approved by DEO; specifies period in which certified production must submit qualifying expenditure data to office; revises criteria for determining priority for tax credits; revises tax credit eligibility; provides tax credit for certain qualified productions that complete certain promotional activities; authorizes credit allocations for specified fiscal years; revises program repeal provisions.

470.title: Public Meetings
470.description: Requires that notice of public meeting include description of each matter to be considered at such meeting; prohibits board or commission of agency or authority of state, county, municipality, or political subdivision from acting upon matter at public meeting which was not included in notice of such meeting; provides exception for certain emergency matters upon approval of super majority of members of board or commission; provides applicability.

471.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee
471.title: Local Government Infrastructure Surtax
471.description: Authorizes use of surtax for restoration or maintenance of natural water bodies for public use.

472.title: Human Trafficking
472.description: Including human trafficking within provisions providing for confidentiality of court records concerning certain offenses involving children; prohibiting the employment of minors in adult theaters; eliminating the statute of limitations for prosecutions under a specified human trafficking provision; repealing provisions relating to procuring a person under the age of 18 for prostitution, selling or buying of minors into prostitution, and reclassification of certain violations involving minors, respectively; providing for expunction of criminal history records of certain criminal charges against victims of human trafficking that did not result in convictions, etc.

473.title: Chemicals of High Concern
473.description: Provides declaration of state policy regarding identification of chemicals of high concern; requires DOH, in consultation with other state agencies, to generate list of chemicals of high concern; provides requirements for review, revision, & publication of list; provides criteria for designation as chemical of high concern; authorizes department to participate in interstate clearinghouse regarding use of chemicals in consumer products.

474.title: Pub. Rec./Animal Researchers at Public Research Facilities
474.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information of animal researchers at public research facilities, including state universities; provides for retroactive applicability of exemption; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

475.title: Palliative Care
475.description: Creates Palliative Care & Quality of Life Interdisciplinary Advisory Council & Palliative Care Consumer & Professional Information & Education Program within DOH; requires program to publish specified information; requires specified practitioners to provide seriously ill patients, upon request, with information about palliative care; requires specified facilities to comply with palliative care measures ordered by health care practitioners.

476.title: Military Affairs
476.description: Prohibits public employer from compelling employee who is spouse of military servicemember to work extended work hours during active duty deployment of his or her spouse; prohibits imposition of sanction or penalty upon such employee for failure or refusal to work extended work hours during period of his or her spouse's active duty deployment; requires public employer to grant request by such employee for unpaid leave for specified purposes during active duty deployment; provides limitation on such unpaid leave; authorizes DMS to adopt certain rules; declaring that act fulfills important state interest.

477.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
477.title: Department of Transportation
477.description: Authorizes a Northwest Florida Regional Transportation Finance Authority to construct, maintain, and operate transportation projects in the northwest region of the state.

479.last_action: Died in Business and Professional Regulation Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1142 (Ch. 2014-95)
479.title: Ticket Sales
479.description: Provides enhanced criminal penalties for second & subsequent violations concerning fraudulent creation or possession of admission tickets; provides criminal penalties for persons who commit such violations involving more than specified number of admission tickets; requires ticket brokers to register with DOACS; requires ticket brokers & resale websites to make specified disclosures to prospective buyers; prohibits ticket brokers & resale websites from using specified intellectual property in certain circumstances; provides civil remedies; provides criminal penalties for violation relating to resale of tickets; provides that specified provisions do not affect initial sales of tickets, providing that admission ticket represents revocable license.

480.last_action: Died in Business and Professional Regulation Subcommittee
480.title: Consumer Protection
480.description: Designates act as "Florida True Origins Of Goods Act"; requires owners & operators of specified websites & online services to disclose certain information; provides for enforcement of act; provides for injunctive relief & civil penalties; provides that violations of act constitute violations of Florida Deceptive & Unfair Trade Practices Act.

482.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
482.title: Zero-Tolerance Policies
482.description: Revises intent to require schools to use alternatives to expulsion or referral to law enforcement agencies; requires district school board to adopt rules requiring student found to have committed certain offenses to be placed in alternative school setting or other program rather than be expelled.

483.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee
483.title: Sales and Use Tax/Method for Calculating Tax
483.description: Revises method for calculating amount of sales & use tax to be paid or collected.

484.title: Court-Ordered Expunction of Criminal History Records
484.description: Allows minors who have certain felony arrests to have FDLE expunge their nonjudicial arrest records upon successful completion of prearrest or postarrest diversion program; extends application submission date for minors who completed program before certain date; revises information that must be provided in written statement from state attorney or statewide prosecutor for person to be eligible for expunction; revises when certificate of eligibility for expunction shall be issued; authorizes FDLE to enter certain expunged records in specified databases; requires FDLE to disclose certain expunged records to specified governmental entities.

487.last_action: Died in Children, Families, and Elder Affairs, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7141 (Ch. 2014-161), CS/CS/CS/HB 989 (Ch. 2014-160)
487.title: Pub. Rec./Residential Facilities Serving Victims of Sexual Exploitation
487.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for information about location of safe houses, safe foster homes, & other residential facilities serving victims of sexual exploitation held by an agency; provides exemption from public records requirements for information about location of residential facilities serving adult victims of human trafficking involving commercial sexual activity held by an agency; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemptions; provides statement of public necessity; provides contingent effective date.

488.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 989 (Ch. 2014-160)
488.title: Pub. Rec./Human Trafficking Victims
488.description: Revises exemption from public records requirements for certain criminal intelligence & investigative information to exempt information that reveals identity of victims of certain human trafficking offenses; provides exemption from public records requirements for investigative information relating to criminal history records of human trafficking victims that have been ordered expunged; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

489.title: Canaveral Port District, Brevard County
489.description: Codifies, amends, reenacts, and repeals the district's special acts.

490.title: Pasco County/Sewage Treatment Facility Discharges
490.description: Authorizes DEP to grant exception from requirements prohibiting sewage treatment facility discharges into certain waters of state for applicant's limited wet weather surface water discharge serving to rehydrate surface water body.

491.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 409 (Ch. 2014-200)
491.title: Personal Identification Information Theft
491.description: Provides that it is unlawful for any person to willfully and without authorization fraudulently use personal identification information concerning specified individuals without their consent; provides for surcharge & allocation thereof; provides legislative findings; creates Identity Theft & Fraud Grant Program; provides appropriations.

492.title: Public Education
492.description: Provides to school districts option of statutory waivers from certain statutes in ch. 1000-1013, F.S., & corresponding administrative rules; authorizes school district, upon supermajority vote by district school board, to apply for waiver; authorizes SBE to enter into performance contract with school district to provide waiver; requires compliance with certain statutes.

493.last_action: Died in Select Committee on Gaming
493.title: Horse Racing Industry
493.description: Directs Animal Industry Technical Council within DOACS to prepare report on state's equine breeding & racing industry & requires applicant for slot machine license or renewal thereof holding harness horse racing permit to have on file with Division of Pari-mutuel Wagering an agreement between applicant & Florida Standardbred Breeders & Owners Association, Inc., governing purses & certain awards.

495.title: Retirement
495.description: Revises criteria for membership in special risk class to include members employed as 911 public safety telecommunicator; requires member to have his or her benefits calculated in accordance with provisions for Regular Class members; provides declaration of important state interest.

496.title: Recreational Marijuana
496.description: Imposes excise tax on recreational marijuana; exempts certain activities involving marijuana from use & possession offenses; authorizes persons age 21 & over to engage in certain activities involving personal use of marijuana in limited amounts; provides limits on where persons may engage in specified activities; provides for licensure of marijuana establishments that may engage in manufacture, possession or purchase of marijuana, marijuana products & marijuana accessories or sell marijuana, marijuana products or marijuana accessories to consumer; provides for enforcement; provides for limits on number of retail marijuana stores in localities based on population; provides standards for prospective licensees; provides restrictions on location of marijuana establishments; prohibits certain activities by marijuana establishments; authorizes localities to prohibit one or more types of marijuana establishments; provides an exemption from specified provisions for marijuana research.

497.last_action: Died in Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee
497.title: Mental Health Counseling Interns
497.description: Revises mental health intern registration requirements; revises requirements for supervision of registered interns; deletes specified education & experience requirements; establishing validity period for & providing for expiration of intern registrations; requires licensed mental health professional to be on premises when registered intern provides services in clinical social work, marriage & family therapy, & mental health counseling; prohibits such registered intern from engaging in private practice; deletes clinical experience requirement for such registered interns; deletes provision requiring that certain registered interns meet educational requirements for licensure.

500.title: Termination of Pregnancies
500.description: Revises circumstances under which pregnancy in third trimester may be terminated; authorizes administrative discipline for violation of certain provisions by certain licensed professionals; requires physician to perform certain examinations to determine viability of fetus; prohibits abortion of viable fetus outside of hospital.

501.title: Divers
501.description: Requires all divers to prominently display divers-down flags or buoys in areas in which diving occurs; requires vessel operators encountering divers-down buoys to take specified actions; prohibits divers-down buoys from being used or displayed onboard vessels.

502.title: Public Records & Public Meetings/Public-Private Partnerships
502.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements & public meetings requirements for unsolicited proposals held by responsible public entity for specified period; provides definition; requires recording to be made of closed meeting; provides exemption from public record requirements of records generated during a closed meeting for a specified period; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

503.title: Teacher Education
503.description: Revises eligibility criteria for receipt of minority teacher education scholarship; requires Florida Fund for Minority Teachers, Inc., to submit annual report to Legislature relating to scholarship funds & recipients; revises funding for administration & training program carried out by board of directors of Florida Fund for Minority Teachers, Inc.

504.title: Onsite Sewage Treatment and Disposal Systems
504.description: Authorizes licensed septic tank contractors to perform maintenance & repair on drainfields of certain aerobic treatment unit systems; provides conditions under which owners of existing onsite sewage treatment & disposal systems are allowed to use the systems as integral parts of sanitary sewer systems.

506.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1036 (Ch. 2014-92)
506.title: Nursing Education Programs
506.description: Requires graduates of approved prelicensure nursing education programs who do not take licensure examination within specified period after graduation to complete specified course; exempts nurses who are certified by accredited program from continuing education requirements; revises requirements related to clinical training; revises calculation of required graduate passage rate for approved programs; provides additional requirements for remediation plan; authorizes board to extend probationary status for program that has demonstrated adequate progress toward its graduate passage rate goal; provides for recalculation of passage rates when students are transferred from terminated program; requires nursing education programs that prepare students for practice of professional nursing to be accredited.

508.last_action: Died in Health Quality Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 1065 (Ch. 2014-139)
508.title: Massage Practice
508.description: Suspends massage establishment license or individual massage license if licensee is charged with specified crimes; provides for termination of suspension if charges are no longer pending; provides that suspension remains in effect upon conviction pending disciplinary action by Board of Massage Therapy; provides for restoration of license if charge is nolle prosequied or dismissed or person is acquitted; provides for extension of term of restored license for certain period.

509.title: Licensed Massage Therapists
509.description: Requires applicant for licensure under chapter 480, F.S., to submit to certain fingerprinting requirements; requires DOH to issue emergency order suspending license of massage therapist or establishment & to deny application for certain persons with specified interests in establishment for certain offenses; requires Board to deny application for new or renewal massage therapy licenses for certain offenses; requires applicant for massage therapist license & certain persons with specified interests in establishment to submit to certain background screening requirements by specified date; authorizes department to adopt rules related to corporate assets.

510.title: Public School Improvement
510.description: Requires DOE to fund differentiated intervention & support strategies implemented to improve student performance.

511.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
511.title: Lionfish
511.description: Prohibits importation, aquaculture, & sale of illegally imported lionfish; provides penalties; authorizes FWCC & DACS to adopt rules.

512.last_action: Died in Healthy Families Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7141 (Ch. 2014-161)
512.title: Commercially Sexually Exploited Children
512.description: Specifies when child believed to be commercially sexually exploited may be taken into custody; provides requirements for handling such children when taken into custody; provides for assessment of such children who are placed in custody of DCF; provides for placement of children found to be at high risk of continued sexual exploitation in protective secure residential treatment programs; provides criteria for placement in residential programs; provides for reports of examiners; requires dependency petitions in certain circumstances; requires report if child does not meet criteria for placement under specified provisions; specifies requirements for DCF if child is placed under specified provisions; requires reassessment of child who runs away & returns; specifies burden of proof in hearings; specifies that safe harbor provisions apply to children who are victims of commercial sexual exploitation.

513.last_action: Died in Ethics and Elections Subcommittee
513.title: Elections
513.description: Establishes rights of electorate; requires that any restriction on voting rights or any change in voting practices be narrowly tailored to serve compelling state interest; provides equal protection of right to vote; authorizes use of violation of act as claim or defense in judicial proceeding.

514.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
514.title: Ocean Highway and Port Authority, Nassau County
514.description: Revises weight limit on break-bulk freight.

515.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
515.title: Development Exactions
515.description: Prohibits local governments from imposing or requiring certain exactions on or against private property; provides exceptions.

517.title: Pub. Rec./CDD Surveillance Recordings
517.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for surveillance recordings held by community development district; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

518.last_action: Died in Health and Human Services Committee
518.title: Behavioral Analysts
518.description: Creates Board of Applied Behavior Analysis; provides requirements for licensure & renewal; authorizes board to issue provisional licenses; establishes maximum fees; provides grounds for disciplinary action by board; provides penalties for unlicensed practice or wrongfully identifying oneself as licensed behavior analyst; requires applicant for licensure to submit to certain fingerprinting requirements; provides appropriations & authorizes positions.

519.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee
519.title: Voluntary Contributions to Public School Facilities
519.description: Authorizes DOR to accept voluntary contributions from participating businesses; authorizes participating business to solicit contributions from customers; directs DOR to deposit contributions into Public Education Capital Outlay & Debt Service Trust Fund; authorizes DOR to adopt emergency rules.

520.title: Citizens Property Insurance Corporation
520.description: Extending the date after which certain structures cease to be eligible for coverage by the corporation; providing that a condominium is deemed ineligible for commercial residential wind-only coverage under certain conditions, etc.

521.title: Pharmacy Services
521.description: Requires certain health benefit plans to allow licensed or permitted pharmacist or pharmacy that agrees to specified conditions to serve as participating pharmacy provider for Medicaid subscribers; specifies that section does not require or authorize rulemaking.

522.title: Eyewitness Identification
522.description: Designates act as "Eyewitness Identification Reform Act"; requires state, county, municipal, & other law enforcement agencies that conduct lineups to follow specified procedures; requires eyewitness to sign acknowledgement that he or she received instructions about procedures from law enforcement agency; specifies remedies for failing to adhere to procedures; requires Criminal Justice Standards & Training Commission to create educational materials & conduct training programs.

523.title: Custodial Interrogations
523.description: Requires that statements made during covered custodial interrogations be recorded; requires that electronic recordings be preserved for specified period; provides that failure to electronically record interrogation shall be factor for trial court & jury to consider when making certain decisions; provides for cautionary jury instructions, if requested; specifies that no civil cause of action arises from failure to comply with requirement.

524.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
524.title: Reemployment Assistance Appeals Commission
524.description: Revises membership requirements of commission; removes provision requiring payment of daily stipend for certain commissioners.

525.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
525.title: School Board of Lee County
525.description: Provides for referendum to increase number of school board members from five to seven.

526.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
526.title: Economic Incentive Programs
526.description: Provides that certain information disclosed or published in specified manner is no longer confidential & exempt; requires DEO to contract with independent third party to verify compliance with economic development incentive requirements; requires DEO to publish results of independent third party review within specified period; deletes provision excluding board of directors of EFI from provision prohibiting solicitation & acceptance of certain gifts; requires two-thirds vote for certain contracts executed by EFI; reduces state operational funding to EFI under certain circumstances; requires person appointed president of board of directors of EFI to be confirmed by Senate; provides requirements for incentive payments made to employees of EFI.

527.title: Sexual Predator and Sexual Offender Absconders
527.description: Creates Sexual Predator & Sexual Offender Absconder Strike Force within FDLE; provides for membership & terms of strike force; provides for meetings; specifies duties of strike force; requires annual reports; provides appropriation.

528.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee
528.title: Utility Cost Containment Bonds
528.description: Designates act as "Utility Cost Containment Bond Act"; authorizes authority on behalf of local agencies to finance utility projects using cost containment bonds; provides criteria for use by local agencies in financing utility projects; specifies how utility project charges become effective & how they are to be paid; provides parameters in use of utility cost containment bonds; prohibits utility bond documents from obligating state or political subdivision thereof to enact tax or make appropriation to pay bonds; provides restrictions on type of legal obligations that financing costs constitute; clarifies issues related to utility project property; identifies lien priority of utility project property in securing payment of utility cost containment bonds; prohibits authority, or governmental officer or organization on its behalf, from filing bankruptcy; provides for liberal construction.

530.title: Community Schools Initiative
530.description: Requires DOE to implement Reigniting Education Achievement with Coordinated Help (REACH) Program as public-private partnership in low-performing public schools; authorizes funding; specifies services to be offered with goal of improving student academic achievement; requires DOE to submit report to Legislature at conclusion of program.

532.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
532.title: Value Adjustment Boards
532.description: Adds rights to Florida Taxpayer's Bill of Rights concerning assessment determinations; requires DOR to adopt rules to establish transparent, fair, & uniform value adjustment board process; provides that uniform policies & procedures manual developed by DOR shall be used by value adjustment board attorneys; defines term "value adjustment board attorney"; provides training requirements for counsel to value adjustment board; revises requirements for written decisions rendered by value adjustment board; requires certain persons to complete training for special magistrates; revises qualifications for special magistrates; provides applicability.

533.title: Athletics
533.description: Requires specified organizations using specified facilities to comply with policies regarding bullying & harassment; requires FHSAA to adopt specified guidelines regarding promotion of respectful conduct in interscholastic athletics; requires that specified participants in athletics sign pledge; requires that certain athletics coaching staff be trained in policies promoting mutual respect in athletics; requires sanctions for bullying or harassment that occurs in games or competitions; prohibits bullying or harassment in intercollegiate athletics; provides that there is no private right of action; provides for referring of incidents to proper authorities; provides that it is an unlawful employment practice for professional sports franchise to fail to take reasonable measures to prevent abusive conduct; provides that there is no private right of action; provides for enforcement by AG in civil action; provides affirmative defense; provides that act may not be construed or implemented to infringe upon right of free speech.

534.last_action: Died in Select Committee On Health Care Workforce Innovation
534.title: Medical Education Reimbursement and Loan Repayment Program
