534.description: Requires DOH to conduct pilot project for implementation of program in specified counties; provides purpose of pilot project; provides applicability of Medical Education Reimbursement & Loan Repayment Program to pilot project; requires DOH to submit report to Governor & Legislature; provides for expiration; authorizes DOH to adopt rules; requires DOH to request sufficient funding for pilot project.

535.title: Hazardous Walking Conditions
535.description: Revises criteria that determine hazardous walking condition for public school students; revises procedures for inspection & identification of hazardous conditions; requires district school boards to provide transportation to students who would be subjected to hazardous conditions; requires state or local entities with jurisdiction over road with hazardous condition to correct condition.

536.title: Aquatic Preserves
536.description: Creates Nature Coast Aquatic Preserve; provides powers & duties of the Board of Trustees of the Internal Improvement Trust Fund; provides certain riparian rights; provides for enforcement & applicability; provides appropriations & authorizes positions.

537.last_action: Died in Business and Professional Regulation Subcommittee
537.title: Interpreters for Individuals who are Deaf, Hard of Hearing, or Deaf-Blind
537.description: Creates Board of Interpreters for Deaf, Hard of Hearing & Deaf-Blind within DBPR; authorizes board to adopt rules; requires licensure of professional interpreters for individuals who are deaf, hard of hearing, or deaf-blind; establishes fees for applications, licenses, license renewal, & administration; provides requirements for licensure, license by endorsement, license renewal, continuing education, & provisional license; provides that licensee must have active license to engage professionally as interpreter; provides for election of license status and requirements to change status; requires DBPR to provide certain notice to licensee by specified time; prohibits certain acts & provides penalties; prohibits use of public funds to employ unlicensed interpreter; prohibits certain employment or subcontracting of unlicensed interpreter.

539.title: Special Districts
539.description: Exempts conversion of certain water control districts into community development districts from specific charter requirements; requires DEO to publish certain information on its website; authorizes department to coordinate with DOS for certain purposes; creates an exception for conversion of certain water control districts; creates an exception for establishment of certain community development district; requires districts created by conversion of water control districts to record notice of establishment; exempts acts creating districts by conversion of water control districts; creates part II of chapter 190, F.S., relating to conversion of water control districts to community development districts; authorizes popularly elected governing board of water control district to conduct certain referenda; provides referendum requirements & procedures; creates prohibition on enacting special laws granting additional powers without prior referendum; authorizes conversion of water control district to community development district by special or local legislation.

540.title: Emergency Allergy Treatment
540.description: Expands provisions to apply to all emergency allergy reactions, rather than to insect bites only; authorizes certain health care practitioners to prescribe epinephrine auto-injectors to authorized entity; authorizes such entities to maintain supply of epinephrine auto-injectors; authorizes certified individuals to use epinephrine auto-injectors; authorizes uncertified individuals to use epinephrine auto-injectors under certain circumstances; provides immunity from liability.

541.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
541.title: Recovered Materials
541.description: Exempts certain recovered materials dealers from liability relating to site rehabilitation costs.

542.title: Civil Liability of Farmers
542.description: Expands existing exemption from civil liability for farmers who gratuitously allow person to enter upon their land for purpose of removing farm produce or crops left in field after harvesting to include farmers who gratuitously allow person to enter upon their land to remove farm produce or crops; revises exceptions to exemption from civil liability.

543.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
543.title: Postsecondary Education
543.description: Requires BOG to establish pilot program to create system under which person who is accepted to attend institution of higher learning may forgo paying tuition & fees if he or she contracts with institution to pay to institution or state percentage of his or her income for specified number of years after graduation, transfer, withdrawal, or expulsion.

544.title: Expansion of School Counseling Resources
544.description: Establishes task force in DOE to study impact on students of increasing number of school counselors in public schools.

545.title: High School Graduation Requirements
545.description: Provides that AP computer science course is equivalent to certain mathematics-based quantitative courses for purposes of meeting graduation requirements.

546.title: Acme Improvement District, Palm Beach County

547.title: West Palm Beach Police Pension Fund
547.description: Revises funding of share accounts, member contributions, & refunds with respect to West Palm Beach Police Pension Fund.

548.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
548.title: Nonresidential Farm Buildings, Farm Fences, and Farm Signs
548.description: Exempts nonresidential farm buildings, farm fences, & farm signs located on lands used for bona fide agricultural purposes from certain county & municipal assessments.

549.title: Nursing Home Administration
549.description: Requires nursing homes to maintain certain malpractice insurance coverage.

550.last_action: Died in Government Operations Appropriations Subcommittee
550.title: Public Records and Meetings
550.description: Provides that public records requests need not be in writing unless otherwise required by law; requires custodian of public records to provide statutory citation to requester if written request is required; restricts charge assessed by agency in producing records; revises contract requirements between public agency & contractor; requires agencies to provide training on requirements of ch. 119, F.S.; specifies reasonable cost of enforcement; provides that party filing action against certain agencies, boards, or commissions is not required to serve copy of pleading claiming attorney fees on DFS; requires agency, board, or commission to provide notice of such pleading to DFS; authorizes DFS to join agency, board, or commission in defense of such suit; conforms cross-references.

551.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1194 (Ch. 2014-96)
551.title: Citizen Support and Direct-Support Organizations
551.description: Provides for future review & repeal of provisions authorizing governmental entities to establish & operate direct-support organizations (DSOs); requires citizen support organizations (CSOs) & DSOs to annually submit certain information to appropriate agency; requires each agency receiving such information to post submissions on agency's website; requires that each CSO or DSO created or authorized by law be subject to legislative review & repeal.

553.title: Guardians and Wards
553.description: Provides that guardian or attorney is entitled to reasonable fee for services and costs if there is proven benefit to ward by actions of guardian or attorney; revises criteria for award of fees for guardian or attorney; prohibits fee awards when conflict of interest exists; revises what fees for legal services may include; revises requirements for petitions for guardian & attorney fees; revises requirements for composition & appointment of examining committee; revises requirements for examinations & reports; allows family members & caregivers to observe & record evaluations; requires that court dismiss petition if an examining committee member concludes that person is not incapacitated; revises provisions on rulings on petitions for guardianship; revises provisions relating to suspension of trust, trust amendment, or durable power of attorney in certain circumstances; prohibits financial exploitation of ward; provides for forfeiture of personal property used in connection with financial exploitation of ward.

554.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
554.title: Traffic Offenses
554.description: Provides criminal penalties for person who commits moving violation that causes serious bodily injury or causes death of vulnerable road user; defines term "vulnerable road user"; provides requirements for reinstatement of driving privilege.

556.title: Newborn Adrenoleukodystrophy Screening
556.description: Directs DOH to provide requirements for newborn adrenoleukodystrophy screening; provides for certain insurance & managed care coverage.

557.title: Pub. Rec./Financial Statements Submitted for Competitive Solicitations or Contracts
557.description: Revises exemption from public records requirements for certain financial statements submitted in response to competitive solicitation or as term or condition of contract; provides exceptions; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

558.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
558.title: South Indian River Water Control District, Palm Beach County
558.description: Authorizes construction of certain improvements on district property.

559.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
559.title: Seminole Improvement District, Palm Beach County
559.description: Authorizes district to provide telecommunications infrastructure within the district.

561.title: Home Health Care
561.description: Requires certified nursing assistant or home health aide referred for contract to provide certain credentials to nurse registry; requires nurse registry to provide certain information to patient or patient representative regarding referrals of independent contractors; provides that person referred for contract by nurse registry is independent contractor; provides duties of nurse registry regarding violation of law by person referred by nurse registry; exempts nurse registry from obligation to review or take action upon records required to be maintained by registry; provides exception.

563.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
563.title: Driver Licenses & Identification Cards
563.description: Requires proof of taxpayer identification number for certain applicants for driver license or identification card; authorizes additional forms of identification that certain applicants may provide; requires DHSMV to mark licenses & identification cards to indicate compliance with REAL ID Act of 2005.

564.title: Lawnmower Safety Devices
564.description: Prohibits removal or disabling of part or device on lawnmower that is primarily for safety; provides noncriminal penalty.

565.title: Education Performance Accountability
565.description: Establishes Transition Education Accountability Task Force; revises time period for implementation of state standards adopted by SBE rule; requires new statewide assessment; requires implementation of new education performance accountability system; suspends school grading system; revises performance salary schedules & performance evaluation for educational personnel.

566.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee
566.title: Publicly Funded Retirement Programs
566.description: Revises applicability of Marvin B. Clayton Firefighters Pension Trust Fund Act; authorizes municipality that provides fire protection services under an interlocal agreement with another municipality to impose excise tax on property insurance premiums; requires municipal services taxing units to provide Division of Retirement with certified copy of ordinance assessing & imposing certain taxes; revises provisions relating to limitation of disbursement; authorizes municipal services taxing unit, under certain conditions, to revoke participation & cease to receive property insurance premium taxes.

567.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 450 (Ch. 2014-75)
567.title: Telephone Solicitation
567.description: Prohibits telephone solicitors from transmitting text messages to consumers under certain conditions; provides appropriations & authorizes position.

568.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1024 (Ch. 2014-187)
568.title: Off-Highway Vehicles
568.description: Revises definitions of terms "ATV" & "ROV" for purposes of provisions relating to registration & use of off-highway vehicles; prohibits off-highway vehicle from carrying more persons than it is designed to carry.

569.title: Home Medical Equipment Providers
569.description: Revises term "home medical equipment provider" to exclude medical practices owned by certain licensed physicians & specified family members.

570.title: Education Standards
570.description: Provides that certain amendments to education standards which provide curricular content to be taught in the state, & statewide assessment of the standards, shall be phased in with full implementation beginning with 2017-2018 school year.

571.title: Orange County Civic Facilities Authority, Orange County
571.description: Repeals ch. 2005-324, Laws of Florida; abolishes the authority; transfers assets & liabilities of the authority.

572.last_action: Died in Business and Professional Regulation Subcommittee
572.title: Licensure as American Source of Supply
572.description: Prohibits person from altering trademark of manufacturer, rectifier, bottler, or brand owner on products shipped into this state.

573.title: Reducing Racial, Ethnic, and Economic Health Disparities
573.description: Requires OPPAGA to conduct study relating to Medicaid provider networks; requires report to Governor & Legislature; provides for expiration.

574.title: Pilot Program in Low-Performing Schools
574.description: Requires DOE to implement pilot program & Commissioner of Education to establish criteria for participation; specifies components of pilot program with goal of improving student academic achievement; provides requirements for implementation of pilot program.

575.title: Education of Children with Disabilities
575.description: Designates act as "Bill of Rights for Children with Disabilities & their Parents or Guardians"; provides for such bill of rights; provides guarantees relating to free appropriate public education, least-restrictive educational environment, IEP, procedural due process, nondiscriminatory assessment, parental participation, & data sharing.

576.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
576.title: Taxes
576.description: Exempts from tax certain separately stated charges imposed on lessee or licensee of leased or licensed premises; authorizes businesses that receive tax credits under Urban High-Crime Area Job Tax Credit Program or Rural Job Tax Credit Program to assign or transfer credits to other businesses; provides limitations on use of transferred tax credits; provides requirements for transfer of tax credits; authorizes qualified target industry business to sell, assign, exchange, convey, or otherwise transfer unused tax credits; provides for carryforward of unused qualified target industry business tax credits.

577.title: Care for Retired Law Enforcement Dogs
577.description: Designates act as "Care for Retired Law Enforcement Dogs Program Act"; provides legislative findings; creates such program within FDLE; requires FDLE to contract with corporation not for profit to administer program; provides criteria therefor; provides specific procedures for how funds will be disbursed for veterinary care of eligible retired law enforcement dogs; limits amount of funds available for eligible retired law enforcement dog in any one year; provides for deposit of program funds; provides for reversion of funds to FDLE; provides for carryforward of unexpended appropriations for use in program up to certain limits; provides for rulemaking; provides annual appropriation.

578.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
578.title: Pet Services and Advocacy Programs
578.description: Designates act as "Pets' Trust Act"; authorizes counties to create independent special districts &, if approved by referendum, levy ad valorem taxes to provide funding for pet services & advocacy programs; creates Pets' Trust council; provides for council membership, powers, & functions; provides that certain nonbinding straw ballots satisfy referendum requirements.

579.title: False Personation
579.description: Revises who is prohibited from being falsely personated; prohibits sale or transfer of specified badges bearing in any manner or combination words "fire department" & ownership or operation of vehicles marked or identified by words "fire department"; requires specified intent for certain offenses; provides exception.

580.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
580.title: State University Fee Exemptions
580.description: Provides exemption from payment of tuition for students enrolled in specified foreign language courses offered at state university under certain circumstances; provides for future expiration unless reviewed & reenacted by Legislature.

581.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
581.title: Agricultural Job Tax Credit
581.description: Provides tax credit to eligible agricultural businesses that employ certain qualified employees; requires eligible agricultural businesses to apply to DEO for tax credit approval; specifies that business seeking tax credit is responsible for demonstrating that it meets requirements for tax credit; provides for carryforward of tax credits; authorizes DEO to adopt rules & guidelines; authorizes DOR to adopt rules; revises order in which specified tax credits are applied.

582.last_action: Died in Healthy Families Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1666 (Ch. 2014-224)
582.title: Protection of Children
582.description: Requires statewide team of child protection investigators to respond to child's death or disappearance; requires DCF to disclose basic facts of all fatalities & near fatalities of children which result from child abuse or neglect; requires that reports & disclosures be posted on DCF's website; provides requirements for release of information if investigation of fatality is pending, if report of fatality is true, or if report of fatality is unsubstantiated; prohibits certain information relating to fatality of child from being released; requires each community-based care lead agency to submit an annual report on damage claims relating to children injured while in care or custody of agency.

583.title: Medical Tourism
583.description: Defines "target health care provider"; requires AHCA & DOH to coordinate with Florida Tourism Industry Marketing Corporation to identify target health care providers; requires Florida Tourism Industry Marketing Corporation to collaborate with interested target health care providers & their local partners to establish health care destinations; requires Division of Tourism Marketing to discuss development of this state as health care destination in division's 4-year marketing plan.

584.title: HIV Testing
584.description: Differentiates between notification & consent procedures for performing an HIV test in a health care setting & nonhealth care setting.

585.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7023 (Ch. 2014-218)
585.title: Microfinance
585.description: Establishes Microfinance Loan Program & Microfinance Guarantee Program within DEO.

587.title: Government Data Practices
587.description: Requires DOS to adopt procedures for agency to establish schedules for disposal of records containing personal identification information; requires agency that collects & maintains personal identification information to post privacy policy on website; provides requirements & exceptions for use of cookies on agency websites; requires that contracts with public agencies specify privacy policies; specifies that violations do not create cause of action; requires AHCA to provide specified information on assisted living facilities; dissolves Center for Health Information & Policy Analysis; requires AHCA to coordinate certain health information data system & establishes conditions for funding; requires OPPAGA to monitor agency's implementation of health information system; requires OPPAGA reports to Legislature.

589.title: Florida Homeowners' Construction Recovery Fund
589.description: Revises legislative intent; revises conditions under which claimant is eligible to seek recovery from recovery fund; revises form required to be provided by contractor which explains consumer's rights under recovery fund; prohibits fund disbursements from exceeding specified amount for each Division I claim & each Division II claim; revises requirements providing caps on payment for certain claims against licensee.

591.title: Health Insurance
591.description: Requires individual accident or health insurance policies, group, blanket, or franchise accident or health insurance policies, & managed care plans to evaluate & review coverage for orthotics & prosthetics & orthoses & prostheses; provides requirements & limitations; specifies deductible & copayment requirements; authorizes insurers to specify certain benefits limitations; provides for nonapplication to certain policy coverages.

592.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee
592.title: Athletic, Exercise, and Physical Fitness Facilities
592.description: Provides that admissions tax may not be levied on sale of athletic, exercise, & physical fitness facility memberships by certain health studios during specified period; authorizes DOR to adopt emergency rules; provides appropriation.

593.title: Executive Clemency
593.description: Requires records relating to clemency investigation of individual subject to judgment imposing death penalty be released to such individual, or his or her legal counsel, upon written request.

594.title: Baker Act
594.description: Requires DCF to create work group to provide recommendations relating to revision of Baker Act; requires work group to make recommendations on specified topics; provides for membership & meetings; requires review of draft recommendations by specified date; requires work group to submit report to specified entities & Legislature by specified date.

595.title: Pediatric Subacute Care Units
595.description: Provides requirements for pediatric subacute care units relating to admission, assessment, & care of patients; provides educational requirements for & responsibilities of staff; requires unit to collaborate with local education agency to develop & implement an education plan for patients above certain age; requires AHCA to adopt rules.

596.title: School Health Services Program
596.description: Requires county health departments to develop school-located influenza vaccination program, subject to available funds & to contract with local health care practitioners or private entity to administer program; provides for administration of program; requires parental consent for immunization of children; requires Emerging Pathogens Institute to provide training & support & evaluation data to county health departments, DOH, & public.

598.title: Use of Wireless Communications Devices while Operating a Motor Vehicle
598.description: Provides criminal penalty if person operating motor vehicle while using wireless communications device causes death of human being or viable fetus; provides enhanced criminal penalty in certain circumstances.

599.title: Educational Student Achievenment Zones
599.description: Authorizes SBE to designate Educational Student Achievement Zones to eliminate areas in state with low student achievement & chronic student failure; provides criteria for designation of zone; requires process for application by educational provider; provides contractual requirements for delivery of educational services; provides accountability measures & for funding.

600.title: Carryout Bags
600.description: Creates statewide standards for reusable bags & recyclable paper bags for stores located within counties or municipalities that adopt specified ordinances; provides for collection & use of fees & imposition of penalties.

601.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
601.title: Fair Associations
601.description: Prohibits county from levying specified taxes, special assessments, or fees against land owned by fair association; prohibits county, municipality, or special district from imposing impact or mobility fee on fair association; prohibits municipality from levying special assessment for specified purposes against real property owned by fair association; exempts specified personal & real property of fair association from ad valorem taxes; prohibits water control district from levying special assessments for proposed works & improvements against real property owned by fair association; exempts real property owned by fair association from maintenance tax by water control district; exempts fair associations from certain assessments or fees by local or regional governmental entities; declares important state interest.

602.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
602.title: Small Business Tax Credit
602.description: Provides tax credit to new small businesses in specified amount; requires new small businesses to apply to DOR for tax credit approval; provides application requirements; authorizes new small business to reapply if application is deemed insufficient; limits amount of tax credits that new small business may receive; authorizes new small business to use any remaining amount of tax credit that is greater than can be taken on single tax return on future tax returns.

603.last_action: Died in Appropriations Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1666 (Ch. 2014-224)
603.title: Child-on-Child Sexual Abuse
603.description: Replaces definition of term "alleged juvenile sexual offender" with definition of term "juvenile sexual abuse"; deletes age requirement from definition of term "child who has exhibited inappropriate sexual behavior"; requires reports involving juvenile sexual abuse or child who has exhibited inappropriate sexual behavior to be reported to DCF's central abuse hotline; provides duties concerning such reports; deletes provisions concerning reports about children over certain age; requires DCF to ensure that information describing child's history of juvenile sexual abuse is included in child's electronic record; requires placement decisions to include certain considerations.

605.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1238 (Ch. 2014-97), CS/CS/SB 1320 (Ch. 2014-102)
605.title: Family Trust Companies
605.description: Designates act as "Florida Family Trust Company Act"; provides definitions & general provisions; provides for formation, operation, & termination of family trust companies, licensed family trust companies, & foreign licensed family trust companies; provides for authority, powers, limitations, regulation, & confidentiality; provides for application & operation of foreign family trust companies; provides appropriations.

607.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1308 (Ch. 2014-101), CS/CS/SB 1300 (Ch. 2014-100)
607.title: Insurer Solvency
607.description: Clarifies that production of documents does not waive attorney client or work-product privileges; revises provisions relating to mandatory control level events; revises provisions relating to insurer's annual statement; revises Standard Valuation Law; revises methods for evaluating valuation of industrial life insurance policies; revises provisions relating to calculating additional premium; requires OIR to value insurer reserves; directs FSC to adopt rules; revises Standard Nonforfeiture Law; revises amount of outstanding voting securities of domestic stock insurer or controlling company which person is prohibited from acquiring; deletes provision authorizing insurer to file disclaimer of affiliation & control in lieu of letter notifying OIR of FSC of acquisition of voting securities of domestic stock company; requires insurer to annually file registration statement by specified date; requires insurer to file annual enterprise risk report; authorizes OIR to assess fees on insurers for certain purposes; applying certain statutes related to solvency to prepaid limited health service organizations & HMOs.

608.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1300 (Ch. 2014-100), CS/CS/SB 1308 (Ch. 2014-101)
608.title: Pub. Rec./Proprietary Business Information/OIR
608.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for proprietary business information & information that is confidential when held by another entity in this state, Federal Government, or another state or nation & which is held by OIR; provides exceptions; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity; provides contingent effective date.

610.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
610.title: Specialty License Plates/Pan-Hellenic Sororities & Fraternities
610.description: Directs DHSMV to develop Pan-Hellenic Sorority & Fraternity license plates; establishes annual use fee for plates; provides for distribution & use of fees collected from sale of such plates.

611.title: Marriage of Minors
611.description: Deletes provisions that allow issuance of marriage licenses to minors under 16 years of age in certain circumstances.

612.title: Preference in Award of Governmental Contracts
612.description: Provides preference for local businesses in awarding competitively bid contracts for construction, printing, & goods & contractual services.

613.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
613.title: City of Vero Beach and Town of Indian River Shores, Indian River County
613.description: Provides for survey of certain City of Vero Beach electric utility customers to transfer provision of their electric service to specified investor-owned electric utility; authorizes PSC, if survey is approved by majority of affected electric utility customers & after public hearing, to open territorial agreement & transfer affected electric utility customers to jurisdiction of investor-owned electric utility.

614.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
614.title: City of Vero Beach, Indian River County
614.description: Requires that utility rates be fair, just, & reasonable for customers outside city limits; authorizes PSC to enforce act & adopt rules; provides that Public Counsel shall represent such customers.

615.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
615.title: City of Jacksonville, Duval County
615.description: Revises membership of the Jacksonville Police & Fire Pension Board of Trustees; provides for nomination of member; requires board to provide budget.

616.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
616.title: City of Jacksonville, Duval County/Biscotti's Espresso Café, Inc.
616.description: Adds special zone to provide exception for liquor license for Biscotti's Espresso Café, Inc.; provides exception to general law.

617.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
617.title: City of Jacksonville, Duval County/Casbah Cafe
617.description: Adds a special zone to provide an exception for a liquor license for the Casbah Cafe; provides exception to general law.

618.title: Lealman Special Fire Control District, Pinellas County

619.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
619.title: Small Business Investment
619.description: Exempts certain funding portals from registration requirements relating to offer or sale of certain securities; exempts certain offers & sales of securities & certain individuals from specified registration requirements; prohibits use of specified exemptions from registration requirements in conjunction with another exemption from registration requirements; provides exceptions.

620.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 89 (Ch. 2014-195)
620.title: Sentencing
620.description: Authorizes judge to impose sentence below mandatory minimum sentence; requires judge to state in writing reasons for departing from or using mandatory minimum sentence; provides factors that judge must consider.

621.last_action: Died in Business and Professional Regulation Subcommittee
621.title: Public Food Service Establishment Inspections
621.description: Provides for transfer of regulation of public food service establishment inspections from DBPR to DOH; requires report for public food service establishment inspections; authorizes public food service establishment to request reinspection; authorizes DOH to increase inspections & charge reasonable fee for such inspections for repeat offenses; authorizes health inspector to immediately close public food service establishment; specifies standards for inspectors; revises licensing requirements, requirements for stop-sale orders, & penalties for misrepresenting food or food products under chapter 381, F.S., to include public food service establishments.

622.last_action: Died in Business and Professional Regulation Subcommittee
622.title: Commercial Breeding and Selling of Animals
622.description: Requires commercial breeders & dealers to comply with certain federal animal welfare standards & rules adopted by DBPR; requires commercial breeders & dealers to register with DBPR; provides registration & fee requirements; provides for inspection of certain facilities; provides penalties; authorizes DBPR to adopt rules; requires retail pet stores to provide certain information to DBPR; provides applicability.

623.last_action: Died in Ethics and Elections Subcommittee
623.title: Early Voting
623.description: Revises authority of supervisor of elections to designate certain locations as early voting sites.

625.title: Conveyance of Property Bought for Airport Noise Purposes
625.description: Authorizes condemning authority to convey lands by lease or otherwise if those lands are condemned for specific noise mitigation or noise compatibility programs at certain large hub airports.

626.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
626.title: Springs
626.description: Specifies distributions to Ecosystem Management & Restoration Trust Fund; revises membership & duties of Acquisition & Restoration Council; requires DEP to establish certain minimum flows & water levels & delineate spring protection & management zone for Outstanding Florida Springs; requires water management districts to establish certain minimum flows & water levels & adopt maps depicting spring protection & management zones for Outstanding Florida Springs; providing funding for protection of Outstanding Florida Springs; requires local government comprehensive plans & ordinances to reflect certain prohibitions; requires DOH, DOACS, & DEP to conduct studies & submit reports; repeals provisions relating to periodic evaluation & assessment of onsite sewage treatment & disposal systems.

627.title: Public Officers and Employees
627.description: Authorizes electors of political subdivision to impose additional or more stringent standards of conduct & disclosure requirements upon political subdivision's officers & employees; provides that respondent is entitled to public hearing upon finding of probable cause of violation of local ethics ordinance; requires local ethics ordinance to establish certain procedures.

628.last_action: Died in Ethics and Elections Subcommittee
628.title: Pub. Rec./Complaints Alleging Violation of County Ethics Ordinance
628.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for complaints alleging violation of county ethics ordinance & any related records held by clerk of circuit court; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

629.last_action: Died in Business and Professional Regulation Subcommittee
629.title: Real Estate Professions
629.description: Revises definition of term "broker" to include short-term or vacation rental property manager & defines "short-term or vacation rental property manager."

631.title: Law Enforcement Officers and Correctional Officers
631.description: Provides exclusive procedures for investigating law enforcement officers & correctional officers for internal & external complaints; provides requirements for investigators; provides that officer under investigation must be informed of specific nature of investigation; prohibits certain practices during an investigation; requires copy of any recording of interrogation session be made available to interrogated officer's representative or legal counsel; revises applicability; authorizes officer's representative or legal counsel to address findings in report before imposing disciplinary action; revises applicability of procedures relating to failure to comply with certain requirements; requires investigation of officer to cease under certain conditions; authorizes an officer to seek injunctive relief.

632.title: Military Veterans with Mobility Impairment
632.description: Providing for eligible Purple Heart license plate applicants to receive the appropriate special license plate with the international symbol of accessibility, etc.

633.title: Government Accountability
633.description: Revises various audit provisions to include district school boards or exclude water management districts; revises responsibilities of department heads, Supreme Court, Florida Clerks of Court Operations Corporation, Justice Administrative Commission, each state attorney & public defender, criminal conflict & civil regional counsel, capital collateral counsel, Guardian Ad Litem program, local governmental entities, & governing bodies of charter schools to include responsibility of establishing certain internal controls; revises responsibilities of district school board's internal auditor to permit certain audits & reviews; requires each Florida College System institution to file certain annual financial statements with State Board of Education; requires each school district, Florida College System institution, & state university to establish certain internal controls.

635.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
635.title: Payment of Tolls/School Buses & District-Owned Vehicles
635.description: Exempts drivers of public school buses & district-owned vehicles from payment of tolls at tollgates, bridges, & ferries.

636.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
636.title: Traffic Control Signals
636.description: Requires traffic control signals to maintain certain signal intervals & display durations based on approach speeds.

637.title: Loxahatchee Groves Water District, Palm Beach County
637.description: Provides for dedication of certain easements to public; provides requirements for dedication; exempts certain property; assigns traffic control.

638.title: Loxahatchee Groves Water Control District
638.description: Provides for dedication of canal maintenance easements to the district.

639.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
639.title: Duval County
639.description: Creates Duval County Library District; provides boundaries; provides for board and membership and duties; authorizes levy of ad valorem assessments; requires referendum.

640.last_action: Died in Healthy Families Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1666 (Ch. 2014-224)
640.title: Nonrelative Caregivers
640.description: Authorizes placement of child with nonrelative caregiver & financial assistance for such nonrelative caregiver through Relative Caregiver Program under certain circumstances; requires nonrelative caregiver to be given temporary legal custody of child.

641.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
641.title: First-time, Nonviolent Drug Offender Tax Credit
641.description: Provides tax credit to businesses that employ first-time, nonviolent drug offenders; requires eligible businesses to apply to DEO for tax credit approval; specifies that business seeking tax credit is responsible for demonstrating that it meets requirements for tax credit; provides for carryforward of tax credits; authorizes DEO to adopt rules & guidelines; authorizes DOR to adopt rules; revises order in which specified tax credits are applied.

643.last_action: Died in Government Operations Appropriations Subcommittee
643.title: Workers' Compensation Fees
643.description: Revises maximum reimbursement allowance for inpatient hospital care; revises date by which panel shall approve allowance; revises maximum compensable charges for hospital outpatient care.

644.last_action: Died in Business and Professional Regulation Subcommittee
644.title: Tax-Exempt Cigarettes
644.description: Authorizes agents & wholesale dealers to sell stamped & untaxed cigarettes to tribal business entities; authorizes tribal business entities to purchase stamped & untaxed cigarettes from agents & wholesale dealers; authorizes licensed tribal smoke shops to purchase tax-exempt cigarettes from tribal business entities; authorizes licensed smoke shops to sell tax-exempt cigarettes at retail; requires certain entities to maintain specified documentation; prohibits purchase of more than specified number of cartons of tax-exempt cigarettes; provides penalty; requires license to own or operate a tribal smoke shop; requires tribal business entities to adopt rules & regulations; requires certain tribal business entities to create fund for specified purpose; requires certain tribal business entities to use certain profits for specified purpose; authorizes division to inspect certain accounts & use of certain funds.

646.last_action: Died in Ethics and Elections Subcommittee
646.title: Public Officers & Employees
646.description: Removes exception from prohibited employment or prohibited contractual relationship for officer or employee of certain special tax districts or agency organized pursuant to ch. 298, F.S.

647.title: Rural Letter Carriers
647.description: Exempts rural carriers of USPS from requirements to be restrained by safety belt while performing their duties.

648.last_action: Died in Health and Human Services Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5003 (Ch. 2014-53)
648.title: State Employees' Prescription Drug Program
648.description: Reenacts & amends provisions relating to state employees' prescription drug program; deletes requirement that DMS base its decision as to whether to implement certain 90-day supply limit on determination that it would be in best financial interest of state; revises pharmacy dispensing fee; authorizes retail pharmacy to fill 90-day supply of certain drugs; repeals reversion of provisions relating to state employees' prescription drug program.

649.title: Vessel Safety
649.description: Provides for FWCC & certain law enforcement agencies or officers to relocate or remove vessels that constitute navigation hazard or interfere with another vessel.

650.title: Cold Case Initiative Program
650.description: Establishes program within FDLE; provides purpose of program; defines "cold case"; requires FDLE to develop database of cold cases; provides requirements for database; provides for public website that includes specified information; requires law enforcement agency to provide list of cold cases; requires FDLE to coordinate with law enforcement agencies; requires FDLE to adopt rules.

652.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
652.title: Gainesville Regional Utilities, Alachua County
652.description: Requires proxy vote by mail ballot of utility's account holders to decide whether to establish Gainesville Regional Utility Authority & transfer utility from City of Gainesville to authority; provides for establishment of authority; provides for appointment, qualifications, & terms of authority's governing board; authorizes authority to set utility service rates; establishes Ratepayer Advisory Committee to submit recommendations to authority; provides for transfer of governance, management, & operation of utility from city to authority; requires utility to provide Legislature with proposed charter for utility.

654.title: Lee County/Village of Estero
654.description: Creates Village of Estero; requires referendum; provides charter.

655.title: Federal RESTORE Act/Gulf Coast States Restoration
655.description: Clarifies that process by which county, or entity formed by state or county, appropriates funds received through RESTORE Act is subject to open government requirements; requires county receiving funds to post proposed appropriations of funds received under act as line item on website within certain timeframe.

656.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
656.title: Cats and Dogs
656.description: Requires specified disclosures concerning breeders of cats & dogs offered for sale in state bred by holders of specified federal licenses; defines "flea market"; prohibits sales & other specified transactions involving live cats & dogs at flea markets; provides exceptions.

657.title: Florida Retirement System
657.description: Revises criteria for employment eligible for purchase of retirement credit.

658.last_action: Died in Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee
658.title: Prescription Drug Monitoring Program
658.description: Provides additional grounds for discipline of licensee of DOH by regulatory board; revises provisions relating to database of controlled substance dispensing information; revises program funding requirements; requires prescriber to access & view certain patient information in database before initially prescribing controlled substance; provides requirements related to release of identifying information; revises information retention requirements; revises provisions required in contract with direct-support organization; requires state to use certain properties & funds to support program; provides for adoption of specific rules by department.

659.title: Gaming
659.description: Creates Gaming Control Commission & Department of Gaming Control to provide for oversight of pari-mutuel facilities, slot machines, cardrooms, & gaming; transfers responsibilities & resources for regulation of such facilities & enforcement of prohibitions against gambling to the commission & department; creates Joint Legislative Gaming Control Nominating Committee; & reorganizes & revises gaming provisions.

661.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
661.title: Enterprise Zones
661.description: Authorizes City of Plant City to apply to DEO for designation of enterprise zone; provides application requirements; authorizes DEO to designate enterprise zone in City of Plant City; requires DEO to establish initial effective date for enterprise zone.

662.title: Limousines For Hire
662.description: Restricts authority of special district to regulate use of limousines for hire using digital transportation request services.

663.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
663.title: Qualified Television Loan Fund
663.description: Creates Qualified Television Loan Fund; requires DEO to contract with fund administrator; provides fund administrator qualifications; provides for fund administrator's compensation & removal; specifies fund administrator powers & duties; provides structure of loans; provides qualified television content criteria; requires Auditor General to conduct operational audit of fund & fund administrator; authorizes DEO to adopt rules; provides for expiration; provides emergency rulemaking authority.

664.title: Punitive Damages
664.description: Provides that provisions relating to punitive damages apply to all civil actions in which judgment has not been entered, regardless of when cause of action arose.

665.title: Bail Bonds
665.description: Prohibits transmittal of electronic bonds by unlicensed individuals; allows licensed bail bond agents to electronically transmit bonds in county in which agency is located in certain circumstances; provides for multiple forms of powers of attorney; prohibits bail bond agents from authorizing countersignatures to bonds or powers of attorney; provides that forms for electronic transmittal of bonds may not be furnished to unlicensed individuals; provides for justification of suretyship of bond agents by inclusion of original power of attorney or by initiating electronic transmission of executed power of attorney; provides that money orders & cashier's checks cannot be used to secure more than one bond; allows two or more qualified sureties to each post portions of bond amount; provides for sheriff to select whether to accept electronic bonds in certain circumstances.

666.title: Family Law
666.description: Designates provisions as "Collaborative Law Act"; specifies when collaborative process commences; provides that tribunal may not order party to participate in collaborative law process over party's objection; provides conditions under which collaborative law process is concluded; provides for confidentiality of communications made during collaborative law process; provides exceptions; provides that certain provisions of act are contingent upon approval & publication of court rules governing specified subjects.

667.title: Hillsborough County Aviation Authority, Hillsborough County
667.description: Increases threshold for award of contracts by governing body of Hillsborough County Aviation Authority which are exempt from certain competitive procurement requirements.

668.title: Town of St. Leo, Pasco County
668.description: Excludes specified municipal lands from town; provides that county is responsible for excluded territory; provides applicability with respect to existing contracts.

669.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
669.title: Fellsmere Water Control District, Indian River County
669.description: Codifies, amends, reenacts, & repeals provisions of law relating to Fellsmere Water Control District, Indian River County; renames district the Fellsmere Improvement District, a special tax district; provides legislative intent; provides additional authority relating to provision of public infrastructure, services, assessment, levy, & collection of non-ad valorem assessments & fees, public finance, & district operations; provides district boundaries; provides for applicability of chapter 298, F.S., & other general laws; provides powers of district; provides for compliance with county & municipal plans & regulations; provides for levy of non-ad valorem assessments; provides for collection, enforcement, & penalties; ratifies prior acts & circuit court decrees; provides for severability; provides for referendum.

670.title: Condominium Assessments
670.description: Revises limitations of liability for assessments.

671.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
671.title: Municipal Road Projects
671.description: Designates act as "Disadvantaged Cities Road Improvement Act"; creates Disadvantaged Cities Road Assistance Program within DOT to provide funding for certain road projects; provides criteria for selection of municipalities to receive funding; authorizes DOT to administer contracts on behalf of municipality; requires funded projects to be included in DOT's work program.

672.last_action: Died in Select Committee on Gaming
672.title: Arcades
672.description: Directs DBPR to implement & administer specified provisions that authorize amusement machine businesses to operate in this state; provides for licensure, registration, fees & taxes.

673.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
673.title: Black Cultural Tourism Enhancement Commission
673.description: Creates Black Cultural Tourism Enhancement Commission within DOS; provides powers & duties of commission; authorizes commission to establish or designate direct-support organization for specified purposes.

674.title: Pub. Rec./Trade Secrets in Recycling Reports
674.description: Exempts trade secret information in certain recycling reports submitted by private businesses from public records requirements; provides for future repeal & legislative review; provides statement of public necessity.

676.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
676.title: Florida's Digital Economy
676.description: Creates Qualified Television Loan Fund; requires DEO to contract with fund administrator; provides fund administrator qualifications; provides for fund administrator's compensation & removal; specifies fund administrator powers & duties; provides structure of loans; provides qualified television content criteria; requires Auditor General to conduct operational audit of fund & fund administrator; authorizes DEO to adopt rules; provides for expiration; provides emergency rulemaking authority.

677.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
677.title: Community Redevelopment
677.description: Revises definition of term "blighted area," as applicable to Community Redevelopment Act of 1969, to include land previously used as military facility & adjacent to county-owned zoological park.

678.last_action: Died in Business and Professional Regulation Subcommittee
678.title: Playground Safety
678.description: Designates act as "Playground Safety Act"; requires new & existing playgrounds open to public to comply with specified national safety standards & guidelines; requires inspections of playgrounds by certified playground safety inspectors; authorizes counties & municipalities to require permits & charge fees for construction or renovation of certain playgrounds; prohibits use of state funds for construction or retrofit of playgrounds unless playground meets certain safety requirements.

679.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
679.title: State-owned Lands
679.description: Requires certain recommendations made by Acquisition & Restoration Council be based on certain scientific analysis & reported to Division of State Lands; requires Board of Trustees of Internal Improvement Trust Fund to adopt rules.

680.title: Drug Testing of Public Officers
680.description: Designates act as "Drug-Free Public Officers Act"; requires certain public officers to undergo drug testing; provides procedures for drug testing & challenging results of drug tests; provides that Commission on Ethics shall review & investigate positive drug tests & refer public officers with positive test results to employee assistance or drug rehabilitation programs; requires public officer who refuses to undergo drug testing to resign from office; provides that public official is subject to removal from office for failure to undergo drug testing; provides that public official convicted or found guilty of, or entering plea of nolo contendere to, felony drug offense is subject to removal from office; requires AHCA to adopt rules.

681.title: Pub. Rec./Drug Testing of Public Officers
681.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal medical information collected pursuant to Drug-Free Public Officers Act; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

682.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
682.title: Broward County/Juvenile Civil Citation Process
682.description: Requires each law enforcement agency in Broward County to implement juvenile civil citation process; requires law enforcement officers to issue civil citations to certain juveniles under specified circumstances; provides exceptions; requires agencies providing services pursuant to civil citation process to report to county.

683.title: Key Largo Wastewater Treatment District, Monroe County
683.description: Provides that district is authorized to prescribe, fix, & establish special lower rate, fee, rental, or other charge on residential account of person who is 60 years of age or older or disabled American veteran meeting low income standards; requires referendum.

684.title: City of Ocala, Marion County
684.description: Provides boundaries; authorizes DBPR's Division of Alcoholic Beverages & Tobacco to issue to bona fide nonprofit civic organization specified number of additional temporary permits to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises at certain events in Ocala Downtown Area; provides requirements to obtain temporary permit; requires division to adopt rules.

685.title: Citrus County Hospital Board
685.description: Provides for hospital & facilities to be leased to a for-profit entity.

686.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
686.title: Nuclear and Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle Power Plants
686.description: Repeals provisions for cost recovery mechanisms for siting, design, licensing, & construction of nuclear & integrated gasification combined cycle power plants, including mechanisms that promote utility investment in, & allow for recovery in electric utility rates of certain costs of, such plants.

687.title: Use of Deadly Force in Defense of a Person
687.description: Repeals provisions relating to home protection & use of deadly force, which created presumption of fear of death or great bodily harm in certain circumstances & provided that person has no duty to retreat & has right to stand his or her ground & meet force with force in certain circumstances; conforms provisions.

688.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
688.title: Fireworks
688.description: Repeals provisions relating to testing & approval of sparklers & registration of manufacturers, distributors, wholesalers, & retailers of sparklers; repeals provisions relating to sale & use of fireworks; repeals provisions relating to bond of licensees; conforms provisions.

689.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7147 (Ch. 2014-154)
689.title: Duties of Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
689.description: Repeals requirement that DACS represent Florida in Southern States Energy Compact.

690.title: Traffic Infraction Detectors
690.description: Repeals provisions relating to installation & use of traffic infraction detectors to enforce specified provisions when driver fails to stop at traffic signal.

691.title: Death Penalty
691.description: Deletes provisions providing for death penalty for capital felonies; deletes associated provisions, including provisions relating to representation in death penalty cases, capital collateral representation, jurors in capital cases, prohibiting imposition of death sentence on defendant with mental retardation, determination of whether to impose sentence of death or life imprisonment for capital felony or capital drug trafficking felony, issuance of warrant of execution, stay of execution of death sentence, proceedings when person under sentence of death appears to be insane, proceedings when person under sentence of death appears to be pregnant, grounds for death warrant, execution of death sentence, prohibition against reduction of death sentence as result of determination that method of execution is unconstitutional, sentencing orders in capital cases, regulation of execution, transfer to state prison for safekeeping before death warrant issued, return of warrant of execution issued by Governor, sentence of death unexecuted for unjustifiable reasons, & return of warrant of execution issued by Supreme Court.

693.title: Lewd and Lascivious Behavior
693.description: Repeals prohibition on lewd & lascivious behavior, including prohibition on lewd & lascivious association & cohabitation together by man & woman who are not married to each other; conforms provisions.

694.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1010 (Ch. 2014-90)
694.title: Cable and Video Services
694.description: Removes provisions directing OPPAGA and DOACS to submit reports to Legislature competition in cable & video industry & staffing requirements related to consumer complaints & video & cable certificateholders.

696.title: Administration of County and Municipal Delinquency Programs and Facilities
696.description: Deletes compliance criteria for county delinquency programs & facilities.

697.last_action: Died in K-12 Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7031 (Ch. 2014-39)
697.title: Parental Choice
697.description: Repeals provisions relating to submission of controlled open enrollment plan & annual report on status of school choice.

698.last_action: Died in K-12 Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7031 (Ch. 2014-39)
698.title: Statewide Hotline
698.description: Repeals provisions relating to statewide toll-free school safety hotline.

699.title: Service Learning
699.description: Repeals provisions relating to school district service-learning programs, activities, & policies.

701.last_action: Died in Business and Professional Regulation Subcommittee
701.title: Florida Building Code
701.description: Repeals provisions relating to development & maintenance of biennial coastal building zone construction training program.

702.title: General Appropriations Act
702.description: Provides moneys for annual period beginning July 1, 2014, & ending June 30, 2015, & supplemental appropriations for period ending June 30, 2014, to pay salaries & other expenses, capital outlay-buildings & other improvements, & for other specified purposes of various agencies of state government.

703.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-53, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2014-51), CS/HB 7091 (Ch. 2014-150), CS/CS/CS/SB 218 (Ch. 2014-169), SB 2514 (Ch. 2014-50)
703.title: Implementing 2014-2015 General Appropriations Act
703.description: Implements specific appropriations of the General Appropriations Act for the 2014-2015 fiscal year.

704.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-54, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2014-51)
704.title: State-Administered Retirement Systems
704.description: Increasing the employer contribution to the retiree health insurance subsidy for members of a state-administered plan, Elected Officers' Class, Senior Management Service Class, and Regular, Special Risk, and Special Risk Administrative Support Classes; revising the amount of employer contributions for the next fiscal year; revising terminology to refer to an employer assessment to offset the costs of administering the investment plan and providing education services; providing findings of important state interests, etc.

705.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-55, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2014-51)
705.title: State Employees
705.description: Providing for the resolution of certain collective bargaining issues at impasse between the State of Florida and certified bargaining units of state employees; providing for all other mandatory collective bargaining issues at impasse that are not addressed by the act or the General Appropriations Act to be resolved consistent with personnel rules or by otherwise maintaining the status quo, etc.

706.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2014-51), HB 5101 (Ch. 2014-56)
706.title: Education Capital Outlay
706.description: Requires deposit of certain amount of funds into separate account within Public Education Capital Outlay & Debt Service Trust Fund; requires transfer of such funds to SBA for timely payment of principal & interest on bonds; requires State Board of Education to transfer specified amount of funds into separate account within Public Education Capital Outlay & Debt Service Trust Fund for payment of debt service on certain bonds.

708.last_action: Died in Appropriations Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 850 (Ch. 2014-184)
708.title: Students with Disabilities
708.description: Establishes Florida Personal Learning Account Program to enable parents of students with disabilities to customize their child's education using wide range of instructional services; provides student eligibility, responsibilities for program participation, administration & funding of Florida Personal Learning Accounts, & DOE, nonprofit scholarship-funding organization, & school district obligations.

709.title: State University System Performance Funding Model
709.description: Authorizes state universities to receive designation as preeminent state research universities; requires BOG to establish SUS performance funding model & reporting system; specifies standards for purposes of performance funding model; requires BOG to implement weighted scoring system to measure university achievement of excellence or improvement; provides funding & reporting requirements; requires BOG to design & annually disseminate university report cards.

710.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-57, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2014-51), CS/SB 1666 (Ch. 2014-224)
710.title: Medicaid
710.description: Providing a reconciliation process for the Statewide Medicaid Residency Program; updating references to data used for calculating disproportionate share program payments to certain hospitals for the 2014-2015 fiscal year; providing for continuance of Medicaid disproportionate share distributions for certain nonstate government owned or operated hospitals; providing reimbursement parameters for prescribed pediatric extended care service providers in the Medicaid statewide managed care program; deleting a requirement relating to medically needy recipients, etc.

711.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-165, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2014-51)
711.title: Cancer Centers
711.description: Designates provisions as "Florida NCI Cancer Centers Act"; authorizes funds in Biomedical Research Trust Fund to be used for Florida Consortium of National Cancer Institute Centers Program; revises distribution of certain funds deposited into Biomedical Research Trust Fund; establishes Florida Consortium of National Cancer Institute Centers Program; requires DOH to distribute funding to certain cancer centers; provides formula for determination of allocations; provides criteria for designation of tiers for cancer centers.

712.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-58, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2014-51)
712.title: Additional Judgeships
712.description: Adding judges to certain district courts of appeal, etc.

713.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-59, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2014-51)
713.title: Counsel in Proceedings for Executive Clemency
713.description: Deletes provisions concerning power of trial court to appoint public defender, office of criminal conflict & civil regional counsel, or other attorney in proceedings for relief by executive clemency; deletes provisions concerning appointment of public defender or attorney by court to represent an indigent defendant in death penalty executive clemency proceedings; deletes provisions concerning compensation of appointed attorney representing defendant in executive clemency proceedings; creates new provisions that provide for clemency counsel representation of defendant in executive clemency proceedings & provide for compensation.

714.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2014-51)
714.title: Juvenile Detention Costs
714.description: Provides for total amount of nonfiscally constrained counties' annual contribution for costs of detention care; deletes provisions concerning development & use of methodology for determining amount of each fiscally constrained county's costs of detention care; requires each nonfiscally constrained county to budget certain amount for costs of juvenile detention care; specifies duties of DJJ in providing such counties with certain information; provides for calculation of such amount; provides for specified payments to certain counties over specified period to address disputed billing methodologies during certain prior fiscal years.

715.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2014-51)
715.title: SUNCOM Services
715.description: Requires DMS to design & procure SUNCOM Network, develop SUNCOM services for state agencies, establish network security perimeter, & implement Florida Information Resource Network; requires DMS to make certain network information available on website & provide reports to Governor & Legislature.

716.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-60, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2014-51)
716.title: Distribution of Surplus Lines Tax Revenue
716.description: Adding to the list of sources of funds to be deposited into the Insurance Regulatory Trust Fund; revising the distribution of taxes and interest collected on insurance premiums charged for surplus lines coverage and certain independently procured coverage; repealing provisions relating to the scheduled reversion of statutory provisions related to the distribution of surplus lines taxes and interest, etc.

717.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-61, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2014-51)
717.title: Documentary Stamp Tax Distributions
717.description: Revising provisions for the payment of debt service and other amounts payable with respect to specified bonds; requiring specified funds to be transferred annually from the Water Management Lands Trust Fund to the General Revenue Fund, etc.

718.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-38, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 805 (Ch. 2014-132), HB 5001 (Ch. 2014-51), CS/HB 7081 (Ch. 2014-40)
718.title: Taxation
718.description: Clarifying and updating which services are included under the definition "prepaid calling arrangement" and subject to a sales tax; providing for an additional tax on charges for, or the use of, certain electrical power or energy and the rate for such tax; increasing the amount of tax credits that may be granted for certain approved programs; providing for a sales tax holiday for certain Energy Star and WaterSense products; providing an exemption from the sales and use tax for sales during a specified period of certain tangible personal property related to hurricane preparedness, etc.

720.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 828 (Ch. 2014-182)
720.title: Court System
720.description: Repeals prohibition on practice of law by retired Justice of Supreme Court, requirements relating to Clerk of Supreme Court & Marshal of Supreme Court, requirements regarding manner in which books for Supreme Court library may be acquired, & residency requirements relating to circuit judges; revises provisions relating to Conference of Circuit Judges of Florida; repeals provisions regarding compensation of public defenders & expenditures for public defender's office in newly created judicial circuit; provides for certain judicial branch salaries; repeals provisions that chief judge be selected in each district court of appeal, that three judges consider every case on appeal, that each district court of appeal appoint a clerk, & that certain costs of copies of records in Supreme Court are not taxed against losing party; repeals evidentiary rule regarding evidence of title to land passing from U.S.

722.title: Pub. Rec./Payment of Tolls and Associated Charges
722.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information obtained from payment of tolls & associated charges; provides for retroactive application of exemption; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

723.title: Security for Public Deposits
723.description: Revises collateral-pledging level for public deposits; repeals provisions relating to Qualified Public Depository Oversight Board; provides that notice of default or insolvency of qualified public depository is not required; requires information from nonqualified bank, savings bank, or savings association that acquires public depository by default or insolvency; revises notice requirements for public depositors; revises restrictions on loss protection provisions in certain circumstances in which public depositor fails to comply with notice requirements.

724.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1140 (Ch. 2014-188)
724.title: Pub. Rec./Emergency Planning/DEM
724.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for information furnished to DEM by person or business for purpose of obtaining assistance with emergency planning; provides for retroactive applicability of exemption; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

725.last_action: Died in Judiciary Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 522 (Ch. 2014-2)
725.title: Sexually Violent Predator Program
725.description: Requires DCF to notify the victim, DOC, Parole Commission & sheriffs of specified counties upon release of certain persons; requires DOC to annually submit recidivism data.

726.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-1, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 851 (Ch. 2014-62)
726.title: Military and Veteran Support
726.description: Revises & creates provisions to benefit veterans & servicemembers with regard to Educational Dollars for Duty program; Florida Veterans' Walk of Honor & Florida Veterans' Memorial Garden; governmental & private employment preference; employment & training services; waiver of fees by DPBR & DOH; residency in Florida State Veterans' Domiciliary Home & admittance to state veterans' nursing home; drivers license & learner's permit exemptions & extensions; physician certificate for practice in areas of critical need; establishing certain charter schools; & waiver of certain state university, Florida College System institution, & career center fees; establishes Florida Is For Veterans, Inc. & Veterans Employment & Training Services Program in DVA; assigns various duties to Florida Is For Veterans, Inc., and VISIT Florida for marketing; provides appropriations.

727.last_action: Died in Judiciary Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 526 (Ch. 2014-4)
727.title: Supervision of Sexually Violent Predators
727.description: Requires DCF to notify DOC & Parole Commission if sexually violent predator who has pending term of court-ordered or postprison release supervision is released from custody, tolls conditional release period of persons transferred to custody of DCF.

728.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 522 (Ch. 2014-2), CS/SB 524 (Ch. 2014-3)
728.title: Involuntary Civil Commitment of Sexually Violent Predators
728.description: Authorizes & requires state attorney to refer certain persons for civil commitment; requires agency with jurisdiction over person convicted of sexually violent offense to give written notice to multidisciplinary team as soon as practicable after receipt of such person in county or municipal jail; authorizes multidisciplinary team to consult with specified others as part of assessment & evaluation process; requires second clinical evaluation; revises deadlines for assessment & recommendation; revises duties of DCF & multidisciplinary team concerning evaluation & recommendation; authorizes state attorney to petition alleging that person released from local detention facility was not referred as required for certain reasons; revises provisions authorizing petitioner & respondent to present evidence at civil commitment hearing; requires DCF to provide notice of placement or release of sexually violent predator or person who is in custody to certain persons & agencies; requires DOC to collect & report recidivism information.

729.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 524 (Ch. 2014-3), CS/CS/SB 522 (Ch. 2014-2)
729.title: Sexually Violent Predators
729.description: Designates act as "Protecting Our Children and Adults from Sexual Predators Act"; requires DCF to provide training to members of multidisciplinary team; requires department to maintain data on each case on recommendations of clinical evaluators; requires department to send to state attorney written assessment & determination as to whether person meets definition of sexually violent predator.

731.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 528 (Ch. 2014-5)
731.title: Sex Offenses
731.description: Provides additional requirements for name change proceedings; provides that voluntary disclosure of specified information waives disclosure exemption for such information; adds additional offenses to list of sexual predator & sexual offender qualifying offenses; requires disclosure of additional information during sexual predator & offender registration; requires that sexual predator or offender who is unable to secure or update driver license or identification card within specified period must report specified information to local sheriff's office within specified period after such change with confirmation that he or she also reported such information to DHSMV; revises reporting requirements if sexual predator or offender plans to leave U.S. for more than specified period; conforms provisions.

732.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 526 (Ch. 2014-4)
732.title: Sexual Offenses
732.description: Authorizes orders limiting testimony in open court and in depositions if victim or witness was a child under 16 years of age when specified sexual offense occurred; eliminates time limitations for criminal offenses relating to lewd & lascivious acts if victim is under 16 years of age; revises & creates offenses involving sexual battery; increases felony degree of certain sexual battery offenses; imposes 50-year minimum mandatory sentence for dangerous sexual felony offenders; revises & creates offenses involving lewd or lascivious battery & molestation; provides that voyeurism includes secretly observing another person's intimate areas in which person has reasonable expectation of privacy; provides that sentence points are multiplied for specified sex offenses committed by an adult upon minor; prohibits gain-time for certain offenses; provides for tolling of conditional release supervision; requires split sentence for certain sexual offenses; authorizes court to require sexual offender or sexual predator who is on probation or community control to undergo evaluation to determine whether the offender or predator needs sexual offender treatment.

733.title: Code of Student Conduct
733.description: Provides that simulating firearm or weapon while playing or wearing certain clothing or accessories is not grounds for disciplinary action or referral to criminal justice or juvenile justice system; provides criteria for determining whether certain student conduct warrants disciplinary action; provides criteria for determining appropriate consequences for conduct.

736.title: Juvenile Sentencing
