736.description: Provides criminal penalties applicable for certain serious felonies by juveniles; requires judge to consider specified factors before determining if life imprisonment is appropriate; provides review of sentences for specified offenders; provides for proceedings for determining if life imprisonment is appropriate for offender convicted of certain offenses; provides sentence review proceedings after specified period by original sentencing court for certain offenders; provides for subsequent reviews; requires DOC to notify offender of eligibility for sentence review; entitles offender to counsel; provides factors to be considered in sentence review; requires court to modify sentence if certain factors found; requires court to impose probation if sentence modified; requires written findings if court declines to modify sentence.

737.title: Residential Communities
737.description: Revising the term "community association management"; providing powers and duties of community association managers and community association management firms; requiring a release of lien to be in a specific form; deleting a provision providing for the expiration of certain liens; providing requirements for the execution of a claim of lien, etc.

738.title: Unlicensed Practice of Law
738.description: Exempts persons engaging in certain activities from criminal prosecution for unlicensed practice of law.

739.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 680 (Ch. 2014-44)
739.title: Trust Funds/Re-creation/Federal Grants Trust Fund/DBPR
739.description: Re-creates Federal Grants Trust Fund within DBPR without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform; provides for contingent effect.

740.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 682 (Ch. 2014-45)
740.title: Trust Funds/Re-creation/Federal Grants Trust Fund/DFS
740.description: Re-creates Federal Grants Trust Fund within DFS without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform; provides for contingent effect.

741.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 506 (Ch. 2014-77)
741.title: OGSR/Florida Insurance Guaranty Association
741.description: Removes scheduled repeal of public records exemption for certain records of Florida Insurance Guaranty Association.

742.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 996 (Ch. 2014-186)
742.title: OGSR/Scripps Florida Funding Corporation
742.description: Repeals public records & public meetings exemptions for certain records & meetings of Scripps Florida Funding Corporation.

743.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1108 (Ch. 2014-94)
743.title: OGSR/Dependent Children Insured by Agency Group Insurance Plan
743.description: Removes scheduled repeal of public records exemption for personal identifying information of certain dependent children insured by agency group insurance plan.

744.title: Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
744.description: Directs Florida Board of Professional Surveyors & Mappers to adopt rules establishing specified standards of practice; revises provisions relating to fingerprint records for private investigative, security, & repossession service licenses; renewal of certain firearm licenses; carrying of specified handguns & concealed firearms; consumer claims against certain bonds posted by health studios, commercial telephone sellers, pawnbrokers, sellers of travel; telephone solicitation; issuance & renewal of permits; administrative fines & civil penalties for pawnbrokers; issuance & renewal of permits; & service & notice for administrative complaints; provides appropriation.

745.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 684 (Ch. 2014-46)
745.title: Trust Funds/Re-creation/State Economic Enhancement & Development Trust Fund/DEO
745.description: Re-creates State Economic Enhancement & Development Trust Fund within DEO without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform; provides for contingent effect.

746.title: Juvenile Justice
746.description: Revises numerous provisions relating to juvenile justice; clarifies jurisdictional age restrictions; provides for placement of child in secure detention for contempt of court; revises intake process; requires child to be held in secure detention under certain circumstances; clarifies procedures for releasing child before detention hearing; clarifies when court may order continued detention; revises procedures for transferring child to another detention status; provides new notification requirements when child leaves secure detention; requires DJJ to notify specified parties when child absconds; provides for alternative consequence to address noncompliance with technical probation conditions; expands transition-to-adulthood services to all children; provides for Comprehensive Accountability Report; limits amount DJJ may pay for health care services; provides for criminal penalties for specified employees who inflict neglect upon juvenile offenders; conforms provisions.

747.last_action: Died in Education, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 851 (Ch. 2014-62)
747.title: Career Centers and Charter Technical Career Centers
747.description: Authorizes career center & charter technical career center to offer college credit courses applicable toward specific certificates or degrees; provides process for approval to offer specific degree programs; renames & clarifies applied technology diploma program; revises & clarifies tuition & fees for specific workforce education programs; revises funding calculation & allocation for workforce education programs.

748.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 686 (Ch. 2014-47)
748.title: Trust Funds/Termination/Department of Economic Opportunity
748.description: Terminates specified trust funds within DEO; provides for disposition of balances in & revenues of such trust funds; prescribes procedures for termination of such trust funds.

749.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 688 (Ch. 2014-48)
749.title: Trust Funds/Re-creation/Federal Grants Trust Fund/EOG
749.description: Re-creates Federal Grants Trust Fund within EOG without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform; provides for contingent effect.

750.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 754 (Ch. 2014-181)
750.title: Certificates of Title
750.description: Requires DHSMV to stamp certain information on certificates of title for rebuilt vehicle or mobile home; defines "late model vehicle"; revises requirements for DHSMV to declare certain mobile homes & motor vehicles unrebuildable & to issue certificate of destruction; requires department to issue certificates of destruction for motor vehicles that are worth less than specified amount & are above certain age; requires department to provide report to Governor & Legislature regarding certificates of title for rebuilt motor vehicles.

751.last_action: Died in Military and Veterans Affairs, Space, and Domestic Security
751.title: Emergency Management
751.description: Revising a short title provision; exempting state employees from specified travel expense provisions when traveling under the Emergency Management Assistance Compact pursuant to a request for assistance from another state under certain circumstances, etc.

752.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 676 (Ch. 2014-42)
752.title: Trust Funds/Re-creation/Welfare Transition Trust Fund/DOE
752.description: Re-creates Welfare Transition Trust Fund within DOE without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

753.title: Early Learning and Child Care Regulation
753.description: Changes terminology relating to school readiness & family day care; revises certain requirements & standards relating to child care facilities, VPK program, & school readiness program; revises provisions relating to exemption from certain licensing standards; revises duties of Office of Early Learning & early learning coalitions.

754.last_action: Died in Health and Human Services Committee
754.title: Advanced Practice Registered Nurses
754.description: Redesignates ARNPs as advanced registered practice nurses (APRNs); provides for independent APRNs (IAPRNs) to practice advanced or specialized nursing; exempts IAPRNs from requirement that certain medical acts be supervised by physician; revises APRN certification requirements; authorizes APRNs to administer, dispense, & prescribe medicinal drugs pursuant to protocol; provides for registration of IAPRNs who meet certain requirements; specifies acts that IAPRNs are authorized to perform without physician supervision or protocol; provides for eligibility of IAPRNs for clinical privileges; requires IAPRNs to maintain medical malpractice insurance or provide proof of financial responsibility.

755.title: Information Technology Governance
755.description: Creates Agency for State Technology (AST); provides for appointment of executive director of AST, who shall serve as chief information officer; transfers certain assets and authority of Agency for Enterprise Information Technology, Northwood Shared Resource Center, & Southwood Shared Resource Center to AST; establishes single state data center; revises schedules for consolidation of state agency data centers & computing facilities into state data center; provides additional duties of FDLE Cybercrime Office; repeals provisions for statewide e-mail service; provides appropriations.

757.title: Nonresident Sterile Compounding Permits
757.description: Expands penalties to apply to injury to nonhuman animal; deletes requirement that Board of Pharmacy refer regulatory issues affecting nonresident pharmacy to state where pharmacy is located; provides that pharmacy is subject to certain health care fraud provisions; requires registered nonresident pharmacies & outsourcing facilities to obtain permit in order to ship, mail, deliver, or dispense compounded sterile products into this state; authorizes board to deny, revoke, or suspend permit, or impose fine or reprimand for certain actions; provides dates by which certain nonresident pharmacies must obtain permit; authorizes board to adopt rules; authorizes department to inspect nonresident pharmacies & nonresident sterile compounding permittees; requires such pharmacies & permittees to pay for costs of such inspections.

758.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 678 (Ch. 2014-43)
758.title: Trust Funds/Termination & Administration/DOACS
758.description: Terminates DOACS trust funds; provides for administration & funding of various trust funds; redirects proceeds of trust funds; revises duties of DOACS with respect to Florida Agricultural Promotional Campaign.

759.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-40, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5601 (Ch. 2014-38)
759.title: Tax Administration
759.description: Revises provisions relating to ad valorem taxes, the tax on sales, use, & other transactions, electronic remittance & distribution of funds collected by clerks of court, automated sales suppression devices, & unemployment compensation.

760.last_action: Died in Education, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7031 (Ch. 2014-39)
760.title: School Choice
760.description: Revises charter school provisions relating to applications & contracts, termination of charter, student enrollment, payment & transfer of funds, use of school district facilities, & model forms, contracts, & evaluation instruments; revises provisions relating to high-performing charter schools & high-performing charter school systems; specifies conditions under which virtual instruction provider's contract is automatically terminated; revises eligibility for receipt of capital outlay funding.

761.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1524 (Ch. 2014-189), CS/CS/SB 1526 (Ch. 2014-190)
761.title: Security of Confidential Personal Information
761.description: Designates act as "Florida Information Protection Act of 2014"; requires specified entities to take reasonable measures to protect & secure data containing personal information in electronic form & notify DLA of data security breaches; requires DLA to report annually to Legislature; provides requirements for disposal of customer records; provides for enforcement actions by DLA; provides civil penalties.

762.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1526 (Ch. 2014-190), CS/CS/SB 1524 (Ch. 2014-189)
762.title: Pub. Rec./Notices of Data Breach and Investigations/DLA
762.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for information received by DLA pursuant to notice of data breach or pursuant to certain investigations; defines "proprietary business information"; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

763.title: Ratification of Rules/Department of Environmental Protection
763.description: Ratifies specified DEP rules relating to qualifications & performance reviews of contractors performing certain site rehabilitation activities for petroleum contaminated sites, & procedures for procurement of such contractors, for sole & exclusive purpose of satisfying any condition on effectiveness pursuant to s. 120.541(3), F.S.

765.title: Department of Environmental Protection
765.description: Deleting a provision exempting certain professional service contracts from pollution response action contract requirements; providing legislative findings and intent regarding the Petroleum Restoration Program and the rehabilitation of contamination sites; providing for certain applicants to use a commitment to pay, a demonstrated cost savings, or both to meet advanced cleanup cost-share requirements; revising permit requirements for coastal construction and excavation; requiring the Department of Environmental Protection to promote the public use of aquatic preserves and their associated uplands, etc.

766.title: Professional Sports Facilities
766.description: Revising the distribution of moneys to certified applicants for a facility used by a spring training franchise under specified provisions; providing for municipalities and counties to expend an increased portion of local government half-cent sales tax revenues to reimburse the state as required by a contract; requiring the Department of Economic Opportunity to screen applicants for state funding for sports development; providing that certain professional sports facilities are designated as shelter sites for the homeless during declared federal, state, or local emergencies, etc.

767.title: Ratification of Rules/Office of Insurance Regulation
767.description: Ratifies specified OFR rules requiring title insurance agencies & retail offices of certain title insurance underwriters to electronically submit certain statistical data, for sole & exclusive purpose of satisfying any condition on effectiveness pursuant to s. 120.541(3), F.S.

768.last_action: Died pending review of CS, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 850 (Ch. 2014-184)
768.title: Tax Credit Scholarship Programs
768.description: Revises provisions related to Florida Tax Credit Scholarship Program; creates Florida Sales Tax Credit Scholarship Program.

769.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 650 (Ch. 2014-82)
769.title: OGSR/Inventory of Estate or Elective Estate and Accounting in Estate Proceeding
769.description: Saves from repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act public records exemption for inventories of estate or elective estate filed with clerk of court or accountings filed in estate proceeding; specifies that accountings in estate proceedings must be filed with clerk of court to be confidential.

770.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 858 (Ch. 2014-185)
770.title: OGSR/Florida Defense Support Task Force
770.description: Saves from repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act public records & public meetings exemption for certain records pertaining to USDOD base realignment & closure (BRAC) process held by Florida Defense Support Task Force & those meetings or portions of meetings at which those records are presented or discussed; specifies that records generated during those portions of meetings during which exempt records are presented or discussed are also exempt from public records requirements.

771.last_action: Died in House, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1179 (Ch. 2014-142), HB 5201 (Ch. 2014-57), CS/SB 1666 (Ch. 2014-224)
771.title: Health Care Services Rulemaking
771.description: Revising rulemaking authority relating to the operation of certain abortion clinics; revising the definition of the term "nursing home bed" to remove rulemaking authority for determining minimum space requirements for nursing home beds; removing rulemaking authority relating to inactive nursing home facility licenses; exempting certain home health agencies from requirements relating to documentation of accreditation; revising reporting requirements to be submitted to the Agency for Health Care Administration by home health agencies; revising entities that are not required to submit the report, etc.

773.title: Graduate Medical Education
773.description: Requires Physician Workforce Advisory Council within DOH to conduct an annual survey of certain medical schools, hospitals, & other entities regarding graduate medical education programs; provides reporting criteria; requires department to consult with Department of Economic Opportunity, Board of Governors, & Council of Florida Medical School Deans to develop survey content & design.

774.last_action: Died in Health and Human Services Committee
774.title: Recovery Care Services
774.description: Includes recovery care centers as facilities licensed under ch. 395, F.S.; provides admission criteria for recovery care center; requires emergency care, transfer, & discharge protocols; authorizes AHCA to establish separate standards for recovery care centers for care & treatment of patients; directs agency to enforce special-occupancy provisions of Florida Building Code applicable to recovery care centers; provides applicability of Health Care Licensing Procedures Act; exempts recovery care centers from specified minimum licensure requirements.

776.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 656 (Ch. 2014-13)
776.title: OGSR/Active Investigations of Testing Impropriety/DOE
776.description: Saves from repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act a public records exemption for certain information held by DOE during active investigations of allegations of testing impropriety.

777.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1642 (Ch. 2014-23), HB 7031 (Ch. 2014-39)
777.title: School Accountability
777.description: Revises basis for calculation of school grades & school improvement ratings; revises provisions relating to school improvement & education accountability system, local assessments, & personnel evaluation; provides for transition to new statewide, standardized assessments; authorizes certain bonus rewards to school districts.

778.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 648 (Ch. 2014-12)
778.title: OGSR/K-12 Education Records
778.description: Saves from repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act a public records exemption for K-12 education records; deletes provisions to conform.

779.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 646 (Ch. 2014-11)
779.title: OGSR/Postsecondary Education Records
779.description: Saves from repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act a public records exemption for postsecondary education records & applicant records.

780.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 156 (Ch. 2014-6)
780.title: Motor Vehicle & Mobile Home Taxes, Fees, & Surcharges
780.description: Reduces taxes, fees, & other charges for motor vehicle and mobile home registrations, stickers, & license plates.

781.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1636 (Ch. 2014-191)
781.title: Renaming of Parole Commission
781.description: Renames Parole Commission as "Florida Commission on Offender Review"; renaming parole qualifications committee as "commissioner qualifications committee"; provides legislative findings; conforms provisions.

782.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 932 (Ch. 2014-16)
782.title: Official Florida Statutes
782.description: Adopts Florida Statutes 2014 & designates portions thereof that are to constitute official law of state; provides that Florida Statutes 2014 shall be effective immediately upon publication; provides that general laws enacted during 2013 regular session & prior thereto & not included in Florida Statutes 2014 are repealed; provides that general laws enacted during 2014 regular session are not repealed by this adoption act.

783.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 934 (Ch. 2014-17)
783.title: Florida Statutes/General
783.description: Deletes provisions that have expired, have become obsolete, have had their effect, have served their purpose, or have been impliedly repealed or superseded; replaces incorrect cross-references & citations; corrects grammatical, typographical, & like errors; removes inconsistencies, redundancies, & unnecessary repetition in statutes; improves clarity of statutes & facilitates their correct interpretation; confirms restoration of provisions unintentionally omitted from republication in acts of Legislature during amendatory process & removes gender-specific references applicable to human beings from Florida Statutes without substantive change in legal effect.

784.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 936 (Ch. 2014-18)
784.title: Florida Statutes/Noncurrent Repeal or Expiration
784.description: Repeals specified provisions that have become inoperative by noncurrent repeal or expiration and may be omitted from 2014 Florida Statutes only through reviser's bill duly enacted by Legislature.

785.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 938 (Ch. 2014-19)
785.title: Florida Statutes/DCF
785.description: Amends provisions to conform references within Florida Statutes to redesignation of Department of Children and Family Services as Department of Children and Families by s. 2, ch. 2012-84, LOF.

786.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 940 (Ch. 2014-20)
786.title: Florida Statutes/GED
786.description: Conforms statutes to directive of Legislature in s. 38 of ch. 2013-51, LOF, to change terms "General Educational Development test" or "GED test" to "high school equivalency examination" & terms "general education diploma," "graduate equivalency diploma," or "GED" to "high school equivalency diploma" wherever those terms appear in Florida Statutes.

787.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 942 (Ch. 2014-21)
787.title: Florida Statutes/Rulemaking
787.description: Conforms statutes to directive of Legislature in s. 9, ch. 2012-116, LOF, codified as s. 11.242(5)(j), F.S., to prepare reviser's bill to omit all statutes & laws, or parts thereof, which grant duplicative, redundant, or unused rulemaking authority.

790.description: Saves from repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act a public records exemption for social security numbers of current or former agency employees; provides exceptions to exemption.

791.description: Ratifies specified DOH rules requiring certain trauma centers to maintain participation in specified trauma quality improvement program, for sole & exclusive purpose of satisfying any condition on effectiveness pursuant to s. 120.541(3), F.S.

792.title: Building Construction Policies
792.description: Requiring the Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services to include in its annual report recommendations for energy efficiency; authorizing an employer to present certain documents electronically or physically in order to show proof and certify to the permit issuer that it has secured compensation for its employees; authorizing an agency or local government to require rooftop equipment to be installed in compliance with the Florida Building Code if the equipment is being replaced or removed during reroofing and is not in compliance with the Florida Building Code's roof-mounted mechanical units requirements, etc.

794.title: Adoption of Internal Revenue Code for purposes of Corporate Income Tax
794.description: Adopts 2014 version of Internal Revenue Code; provides for retroactive effect.

795.description: Requires elected municipal officers to participate in annual ethics training; requires officer who is required to participate in such training to certify participation on public disclosure of financial interests; provides that failure to certify completion of training does not constitute immaterial, inconsequential, or de minimis error or omission.

796.last_action: Died in Governmental Oversight and Accountability, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5003 (Ch. 2014-53)
796.title: State Group Insurance Program
796.description: Revises applicability of certain definitions regarding state group insurance program; defines term "plan year"; authorizes program to include additional benefits; authorizes employee to use certain portion of state's contribution to purchase additional & supplemental benefits; provides for program to offer health plans in specified benefit coverage levels; provides for DMS to develop plan for implementation of benefit levels; provides reporting requirements; provides for expiration of implementation plan; authorizes additional benefits to be included in program; provides that DMS shall contract with at least one entity that provides comprehensive pricing & inclusive services for surgery & other medical procedures; provides contract & reporting requirements; provides for DMS to establish 3-year price transparency pilot project in certain areas of state; provides project & reporting requirements; directs DMS to contract with independent benefits consultant; provides requirements for & duties of consultant; provides reporting requirement; deletes requirement that DMS base decision as to whether to implement certain 90-day supply limit on determination that it would be in best financial interest of state; revises pharmacy dispensing fee; authorizes retail pharmacy to fill 90-day supply of certain drugs; repeals reversion of provisions relating to state employees' prescription drug program; directs DMS to provide premium alternatives to Governor & Legislature by specified date; provides criteria for calculating premium alternatives; provides that GAA shall establish premiums for enrollees that reflect differences in benefit design & value among plan options; provides appropriation & authorizes positions.

797.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1262 (Ch. 2014-98), CS/CS/CS/SB 542 (Ch. 2014-80)
797.title: Public Records and Meetings/Insurance Flood Loss Model
797.description: Provides exemption from public records & public meetings requirements for trade secrets used to design insurance flood loss model held in records or discussed in meetings of Florida Commission on Hurricane Loss Projection Methodology, OIR, or appointed consumer advocate; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

798.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1664 (Ch. 2014-24)

800.description: Directs that Commissioner of Education, DOE, & school districts develop & annually update various technology & digital classrooms plans; repeals pilot program for transition to electronic instructional materials; establishes Florida Library Automation Cooperative; provides that cooperative's director shall report to executive director of Complete Florida Plus Program; repeals provisions for licensing of electronic library resources & Florida Virtual Campus; revises Complete Florida Plus Program; establishes Complete Florida Degree Initiative; provides that Articulation Coordinating Committee shall make recommendations to Legislature regarding development of an online system for analyzing student credit transfers & review proposals for industry certifications; transfers Florida Virtual Campus to UWF; requires Board of Governors to submit transition plan to Legislature.

803.description: Exempting specified rules from legislative ratification under certain provisions; requiring the Department of Environmental Protection to publish a certain notice, etc.

859.last_action: Adopted by Publication, companion bill(s) passed, see SR 1764 (Adopted)
859.title: Captain Bill Smith
859.description: Recognizes Captain Bill Smith for being first to catch a bonefish on an artificial fly 75 years ago.

860.title: Duval County Medical Society
860.description: Recognizes 160th anniversary of Duval County Medical Society.

861.title: City of North Miami
861.description: Recognizes 88th anniversary of City of North Miami.

862.title: Village of El Portal
862.description: Recognizes 77th anniversary of Village of El Portal.

863.title: Sickle Cell Awareness
863.description: Recognizes importance of sickle cell awareness in State of Florida.

864.last_action: Adopted by Publication, companion bill(s) passed, see SR 1742 (Adopted)
864.title: Republic of China (Taiwan)
864.description: Expresses appreciation for sister-state relationship between State of Florida & Republic of China (Taiwan).

865.title: Armed Forces Day
865.description: Recognizes May 17, 2014 as "Armed Forces Day" in the State of Florida.

866.title: Haitian Heritage Museum
866.description: Recognizes 10th anniversary of Haitian Heritage Museum.

867.last_action: Adopted by Publication, companion bill(s) passed, see SR 1696 (Adopted)
867.title: Coastal Dune Lakes Day
867.description: Recognizes June 5, 2014, as "Coastal Dune Lakes Day" in Florida.

868.title: Wekiva High School 2014 Girls' Basketball Team
868.description: Recognizes Wekiva High School 2014 Girls' Basketball Team's State Championship victory.

869.title: Healthy Eating Awareness: Lifestyle To Heal You (HEALTHY) Week
869.description: Designates October 20-24, 2014, as "Healthy Eating Awareness: Lifestyle To Heal You (HEALTHY) Week" in Florida.

870.last_action: Adopted by Publication, companion bill(s) passed, see SR 1760 (Adopted)
870.title: Winter Park High School Wildcats Boys Basketball Team
870.description: Congratulates Winter Park High School Wildcats boys basketball team for winning 2014 FHSAA Class 8A Championship.

871.title: Day of the Cowboy
871.description: Designates Saturday, July 26, 2014, as "Day of the Cowboy" in State of Florida.

872.last_action: Adopted, companion bill(s) passed, see SR 1752 (Adopted)
872.title: Bubba Watson
872.description: Congratulates Florida's own Bubba Watson on his 2014 Masters Tournament win.

873.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
873.title: Equal Rights for Men and Women
873.description: Ratifies proposed amendment to U.S. Constitution relating to equal rights for men & women.

874.title: Joint Legislative Task Force on Turkish and Florida Relations
874.description: Creates Joint Legislative Task Force on Turkish and Florida Relations.

875.last_action: Signed by Officers and filed with Secretary of State
875.title: Joint Session for Purpose of Receiving Governor's Message
875.description: Calls for House of Representatives & Senate to convene in Joint Session at 11:00 a.m. on March 4, 2014, for purpose of receiving message from Governor.

876.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SCR 954 (Adopted)
876.title: Joint Rules of the Florida Legislature
876.description: Creates new Joint Rule 7 of the Joint Rules of the Florida Legislature, relating to residency of members.

877.title: Real Property Rights of Aliens Ineligible for Citizenship
877.description: Proposes amendment to s. 2, Art. I of State Constitution to delete provision authorizing laws that regulate or prohibit ownership, inheritance, disposition, & possession of real property by aliens ineligible for citizenship.

879.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
879.title: Municipal Property Tax Exemption
879.description: Proposes amendment to s. 3, Art. VII of State Constitution to allow Legislature, by general law, to exempt from taxation property owned by municipality.

880.last_action: Died in Ethics and Elections Subcommittee
880.title: Legislative Term Limits
880.description: Proposes amendments to s. 15, Art. III & s. 4, Art. VI & creation of new section in Art. XII of State Constitution to revise terms of state senators & state representatives & revise limits on period for which person may be elected as state senator or state representative.

881.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
881.title: Power Plant Cost Recovery
881.description: Proposes creation of s. 28, Art. X of State Constitution to prohibit cost recovery by electric utility of new power plant until plant begins commercial operation.

882.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
882.title: Producers of Renewable Energy
882.description: Proposes creation of s. 28, Art. X of State Constitution to provide that person, corporation, partnership, association, or other legal entity that exclusively produces renewable energy is not a public utility & to provide that definitions of terms "public utility" & "renewable energy" shall be prescribed by general law.

883.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee
883.title: Ad Valorem Assessments/Renewable Energy Source Devices
883.description: Proposes amendment to s. 4, Art. VII of State Constitution to revise Legislature's authority to exempt renewable energy source devices from consideration in determining assessed value of real property by removing restriction that limits such exemptions to property used for residential purposes & restricting such exemptions to renewable energy source devices installed by end-use customer whose primary intent is offset part or all of the customer's electricity demands.

884.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
884.title: Miami-Dade County Home Rule Charter
884.description: Proposes amendment to s. 6, Art. VIII of State Constitution to authorize amendments or revisions to Miami-Dade County Home Rule Charter by special law approved by vote of electors of county; requires that special law be proposed & approved at meeting of county legislative delegation & filed by member of delegation; conforms references to reflect county's current name.

885.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
885.title: Commissioner of Energy/Composition of Cabinet
885.description: Proposes amendments to s. 4, Art. IV & creation of new section in Art. XII of State Constitution to provide for statewide election of Commissioner of Energy; provides for commissioner to serve as state's energy policy chief & supervisor of energy matters & provide specific duties & includes commissioner as member of Cabinet, Board of Trustees of Internal Improvement Trust Fund, & Land Acquisition Trust Fund & as component of head of FDLE.

886.title: Restoration of Voting Rights
886.description: Proposes amendments to s. 4, Art. VI of State Constitution to automatically restore voting rights of person convicted of felony upon completion of his or her sentence unless he or she was convicted of a homicide or sexual offense.

887.last_action: Died in Ethics and Elections Subcommittee
887.title: Term Limits/Cumulative Legislative Service
887.description: Proposes amendment to s. 4, Art. VI of State Constitution to provide limits on cumulative period for which person may be elected as member of the Legislature.

888.title: Voter Control of Gambling Expansion
888.description: Proposes creation of s. 28, Art. X of State Constitution to require that any expansion of gambling be authorized by constitutional amendment proposed by initiative petition & approved by Florida voters & provides construction.

889.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SM 118 (Adopted)
889.title: Fair Tax Act of 2013
889.description: Urges Congress to repeal all taxes on income & enact national retail sales tax as specified in H.R. 25, Fair Tax Act of 2013.

890.last_action: Died in Judiciary, companion bill(s) passed, see SM 476 (Adopted)
890.title: Congressional Term Limits
890.description: Urges Congress to propose to states amendment to Constitution of United States that would limit consecutive terms of office that member of U.S. Senate or U.S. House of Representatives may serve.

891.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Subcommittee
891.title: Federal Government Shutdown/Prorated Reduction of Federal Taxes
891.description: Urges Congress to authorize prorated reduction of all federal taxes to compensate for services reduced or discontinued during Federal Government shutdown.

892.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
892.title: Renewable Fuel Standard
892.description: Urges Congress to repeal the Renewable Fuel Standard established under the Energy Independence & Security Act of 2007.

893.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
893.title: Development, Relief, and Education for Alien Minors (DREAM) Act
893.description: Urges Congress to enact federal DREAM Act.

894.last_action: Signed by Officers and filed with Secretary of State
894.title: Constitutional Convention/Single-Subject Requirement for Federal Legislation
894.description: Applies to Congress to call convention for purpose of proposing amendment to U.S. Constitution to provide that every law enacted by Congress shall embrace only one subject, which shall be clearly expressed in its title.

895.last_action: Signed by Officers and filed with Secretary of State
895.title: Keystone XL Pipeline
895.description: Urges the President of the United States to issue final approval for construction & completion of Keystone XL pipeline.

896.title: United States Department of Education
896.description: Urges Congress to abolish U.S. Department of Education.

897.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SM 476 (Adopted)
897.title: Article V Convention of the States
897.description: Makes application to Congress to call Article V convention for purpose of proposing amendments to U.S. Constitution that impose fiscal restraints on Federal Government, limit power & jurisdiction of Federal Government, & limit terms of office for federal officials & members of Congress.

898.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
898.title: Preclearance Coverage Formula of Voting Rights Act of 1965
898.description: Urges Congress to revise preclearance coverage formula set forth in Section 4 of Voting Rights Act of 1965.

899.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
899.title: National Flood Insurance Program
899.description: Urges Congress to delay implementation of Biggert-Waters Flood Insurance Reform Act of 2012 until specified conditions are met & to eliminate any requirement to immediately increase to full-risk rate a property owner's insurance procured through National Flood Insurance Program.

901.title: Comprehensive Everglades Restoration Plan
901.description: Urges Congress to authorize next phase of Everglades restoration.

902.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SM 658 (Adopted)
902.title: Balanced Federal Budget
902.description: Makes application to Congress to call convention for sole purpose of proposing amendment to U.S. Constitution that requires balanced federal budget.

903.title: Supportive Housing for the Elderly Program
903.description: Urges Congress to restore funding for Supportive Housing for the Elderly Program.

904.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SM 1174 (Adopted)
904.title: Carbon Dioxide Emissions from Fossil-fueled Electric Generating Units
904.description: Urges Congress to direct EPA to use specified criteria in developing guidelines for regulating carbon dioxide emissions from existing fossil-fueled electric generating units.

905.title: Terrorism Risk Insurance Program
905.description: Urges Congress to extend Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002.

907.title: Disaster Savings Accounts
907.description: Urges Congress to pass legislation that allows individuals a deduction for amounts contributed to disaster savings accounts to be used for purpose of disaster mitigation expenses.

908.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
908.title: Fundamental Right to Vote
908.description: Urges Congress to propose to states amendment to U.S. Constitution providing that it is fundamental right of citizens to vote in certain elections.

909.title: Regulation Freedom Amendment
909.description: Urges Congress to propose to states an amendment to U.S. Constitution entitled "Regulation Freedom Amendment," which would require a federal regulation be adopted by majority vote of both houses of Congress if opposed by a specified percentage of membership of either house.

910.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
910.title: Electromagnetic Pulses and Geomagnetic Storms
910.description: Urges Congress to direct Secretary of U.S. Department of Homeland Security to request needed resources for mission of protecting the U.S. from & recovering from impacts of most serious electromagnetic pulse threats & geomagnetic storms.

912.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
912.title: Energy
912.description: Urges Congress to stop increases in federal loan guarantee program for new nuclear reactors & rescind remaining funds, eliminate funding for mixed oxide plutonium fuel plants, support energy efficiency & renewable sources of energy, fund nuclear waste immobilization, increase funding for environmental cleanup programs, enact moratorium by U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission on nuclear waste operations, direct U.S. Department of Energy to comply with all cleanup agreements & legacy management requirements, & authorize nationwide study.

913.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
913.title: United Nations' Agenda 21
913.description: Endorses rejection of UN's Agenda 21 & its underlying harmful policies & urges Congress to reject effort to implement Agenda 21 or such policies in U.S.

914.title: Citrus Greening Disease
914.description: Urges Congress to support Florida citrus industry in its effort to combat & defeat huanglongbing, also known as HLB or citrus greening disease.

915.title: Relief/Mark T. Sawicki & Sharon L. Sawicki/City of Tallahassee
915.description: Provides for appropriation to compensate Mark T. Sawicki & Sharon L. Sawicki for injuries sustained as result of negligence of City of Tallahassee; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs.

916.title: Relief/Barney Brown/DFS
916.description: Provides for relief of Barney Brown for wrongful incarceration & provides appropriation to compensate him; directs CFO to draw warrant; provides that act does not waive certain defenses or increase state's liability; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs.

917.title: Relief/Estate of Lazaro Rodriguez/City of Hialeah
917.description: Provides for appropriation to compensate Estate of Lazaro Rodriguez for injuries sustained as result of negligence of City of Hialeah; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs.

918.title: Relief/Charles Pandrea/North Broward Hospital District
918.description: Provides for appropriation to compensate Charles Pandrea for death of Janet Pandrea as result of negligence of North Broward Hospital District; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs.

919.title: Relief/Thomas & Karen Brandi/City of Haines City
919.description: Provides for appropriation to compensate Thomas & Karen Brandi for injuries sustained as result of negligence of city of Haines City; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs.

920.title: Relief/J.D.S./Agency for Persons with Disabilities
920.description: Provides appropriation from General Revenue Fund to compensate J.D.S. for negligence by APD, as successor agency of DCF; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs.

921.title: Relief/Joseph Stewart & Audrey Stewart/City of Jacksonville
921.description: Provides for relief of Joseph Stewart & Audrey Stewart on behalf of their son, Aubrey Stewart, by City of Jacksonville; provides for appropriation to compensate Aubrey Stewart for injuries sustained as result of negligence of City of Jacksonville; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs; provides for repayment of Medicaid liens.

922.title: Relief/Javier Soria/Palm Beach County
922.description: Provides for appropriation to compensate Javier Soria for injuries sustained as result of negligence by employee of Palm Beach County; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs.

923.title: Relief/Ramiro Companioni/City of Tampa
923.description: Provides for appropriation to compensate Ramiro Companioni for injuries sustained as result of negligence of City of Tampa employee; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs.

924.title: Relief/Monica Cantillo Acosta & Luis Alberto Cantillo Acosta/Miami-Dade County
924.description: Provides for appropriation to compensate Monica Cantillo Acosta & Luis Alberto Cantillo Acosta, surviving children of Nhora Acosta, for wrongful death of mother due to injuries sustained as result of negligence of Miami-Dade County bus driver; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs.

925.title: Relief/Donald Brown/District School Board of Sumter County
925.description: Provides for appropriation to compensate Donald Brown for injuries sustained as result of negligence of District School Board of Sumter County; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs.

926.title: Relief/Dennis Darling, Sr. & Wendy Smith/State of Florida
926.description: Provides appropriation to compensate Dennis Darling, Sr. & Wendy Smith, parents of Devaughn Darling, whose death occurred while engaged in football preseason training on FSU campus; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs.

927.title: Relief/L.T., a minor/Department of Children and Families
927.description: Provides appropriation from State Treasury to compensate L.T. for injuries & damages sustained as result of negligence of DCF employees; provides limitation of payment of fees & costs.

928.title: Relief/Brian Pitts
928.description: Provides for relief of Brian Pitts; directs DOAH to appoint administrative law judge to determine basis for equitable relief for purpose of compensating Mr. Pitts for any wrongful act or omission by state or officials thereof; requires report to Legislature; authorizes compensation upon determination by administrative law judge; provides appropriation to compensate Mr. Pitts for injuries & damages sustained; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs; directs that certain court orders & judgments be declared null & void; authorizes Mr. Pitts to practice law under certain circumstances; provides for severability.

929.title: Relief/Carl Abbott/Palm Beach County School District
929.description: Provides for appropriation to compensate Carl Abbott for injuries sustained as result of negligence of Palm Beach County School District; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs.

930.title: Relief/Ronald Miller/City of Hollywood
930.description: Provides for appropriation to compensate Ronald Miller for injuries sustained as result of negligence of employee of City of Hollywood; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs.

936.title: Juvenile Offenders
936.description: Citing this act as the "Juvenile Sentencing Review Act"; providing that a juvenile offender who was younger than 18 years of age at the time of the commission of a nonhomicide or homicide offense and who is sentenced to life imprisonment is eligible for resentencing if the offender has been incarcerated for a minimum period; requiring that the Department of Corrections conduct a screening to determine whether a juvenile offender is eligible for a resentencing hearing; providing that a juvenile offender is entitled to legal representation for a resentencing hearing, etc.

938.title: Short Sale Debt Relief
938.description: Creating the "Short Sale Debt Relief Act"; providing that a debtor does not owe a deficiency to a lienholder related to an eligible real property sold pursuant to a bona fide short sale if an offer is received by the debtor within a specified time period and under specified conditions; requiring a lienholder to approve the short sale of property and execute any document necessary to close the sale within a specified time period if a debtor procures a buyer who makes an offer in writing equal to the fair market value of the eligible property, etc.

939.last_action: Died in Appropriations, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 851 (Ch. 2014-62), CS/CS/HB 7015 (Ch. 2014-1)
939.title: Waivers of Out-of-state Fees for Veterans
939.description: Citing this act as the "Congressman C. W. Bill Young Veteran Tuition Waiver Act"; establishing the Congressman C. W. Bill Young Veteran Tuition Waiver Program; requiring a state university or Florida College System institution to waive out-of-state fees for certain veterans of the Armed Forces of the United States, including the National Guard and reserve components thereof; requiring a state university and Florida College System institution to report to the Board of Governors and the State Board of Education, respectively, the number and value of all fee waivers, etc.

941.title: School Attendance
941.description: Providing that compulsory school attendance laws apply to all children between the ages of 6 and 18 years; providing that a student who attains the dropout age does not need a parent's signature to file a declaration of intent to terminate school; requiring students to attend school until the age of 18 years; repealing provisions relating to a requirement that district school boards make available a GED program to students in juvenile justice facilities who attain the age of 16 years or notify such students that they are no longer required to attend school, etc.

942.title: Limited English Proficient Students
942.description: Authorizing exemption from certain state standardized assessments for limited English proficient students under certain circumstances, etc.

943.title: English Language Instruction
943.description: Providing that a student's parent has the right to request that the student be exempted from instruction in English language proficiency; requiring a school district to exempt a student from participating in instruction in English language proficiency if the student's parent requests the exemption in writing, etc.

944.title: Jury Composition
944.description: Requiring a 12-member jury for life felony cases, etc.

947.title: Assault or Battery On a Utility Worker
947.description: Defining the term "utility worker"; providing for reclassification of certain offenses committed against a utility worker; amending provisions relating to the offense severity ranking chart of the Criminal Punishment Code, to incorporate the amendment made to s. 784.07, F.S., in references thereto, etc.

951.title: Public Records/Claim Settlement on Behalf of a Minor or Ward
951.description: Creating an exemption from public records requirements for records relating to the settlement of a claim on behalf of a minor or ward; authorizing a guardian ad litem, a ward, a minor, and a minor's attorney to inspect guardianship reports and court records relating to the settlement of a claim on behalf of a minor or ward, upon a showing of good cause; authorizing the court to direct disclosure and recording of an amendment to a report or court records relating to the settlement of a claim on behalf of a ward or minor, in connection with real property or for other purposes, etc.

952.last_action: Died in Appropriations Subcommittee on Finance and Tax
952.title: Taxes on Businesses
952.description: Creating the "Florida Veterans Employment Act"; establishing a tax credit for the hiring of veterans; establishing an additional credit for the hiring of disabled veterans; authorizing the department to establish guidelines for qualifying credits; revising the order in which credits against the corporate income tax or franchise tax may be taken to include the hiring of veterans, etc.

953.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 89 (Ch. 2014-195)
953.title: Possession or Discharge of a Firearm or Destructive Device During the Commission of Specified Offenses
953.description: Providing that a sentencing court may elect not to impose the minimum term of imprisonment for a person convicted of certain offenses during which the person actually possessed or discharged a firearm or destructive device if the court finds that certain specified criteria are met; requiring a sentencing court that elects not to impose the mandatory minimum sentence for the relevant offense to make specific findings to support its decision to impose a lesser term, etc.

956.title: Fees and Costs Incurred in Guardianship Proceedings
956.description: Providing that fees and costs incurred by an attorney who has rendered services to a ward in compensation proceedings are payable from guardianship assets; providing that a court may appoint a guardian ad litem to represent a minor if necessary to protect the minor's interest in a settlement; requiring that the examining committee be paid from state funds as court-appointed expert witnesses if a petition for incapacity is dismissed; requiring that a petitioner reimburse the state for expert witness fees if the court finds the petition to have been filed in bad faith, etc.

957.title: Self-defense
957.description: (THIS BILL COMBINED IN CS/S130 & S122) Requiring the county sheriff or municipal police to issue reasonable guidelines for the operation of a neighborhood crime watch program; authorizing a person to use force, except deadly force in the defense of property; providing that a person who uses force is immune from civil action brought by the person or persons against whom the force is used; providing that a law enforcement agency's right and duty to fully investigate the use of force upon which the claim of immunity is based is not restricted; directing the Department of Law Enforcement to collect, process, maintain, and disseminate information and data on all incidents concerning the alleged justifiable use of force in this state, etc.

959.title: Residential Foreclosure Proceedings
959.description: Citing this act as the "Florida Mortgage Collection Fairness Act"; prohibiting a mortgage collection firm from offering false evidence in a residential mortgage foreclosure proceeding; providing that a violation is a deceptive and unfair trade practice; providing penalties and remedies including attorney fees and costs, etc.

960.title: Aerosol Spray Paint
960.description: Prohibiting the sale of aerosol spray paint to persons younger than 18 years of age; providing a defense; requiring a business that sells aerosol spray paint to post a certain sign; prohibiting a person from misrepresenting his or her age in order to purchase aerosol spray paint; providing penalties; authorizing local governments to use collected fines for the improvement or maintenance of neighborhoods and parks, etc.

962.title: Specialty License Plates
962.description: Authorizing the collection of annual use fees for the Fallen Law Enforcement Officers license plate, the Florida Sheriffs Association license plate, the Keiser University license plate, and the Moffitt Cancer Center license plate; revising provisions relating to the distribution of annual use funds to the Astronauts Memorial Foundation, Inc., for the Challenger/Columbia specialty license plate; requiring the Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles to discontinue the plates under certain circumstances; establishing an annual use fee for the plates; providing for the distribution of use fees received from the sale of such plates, etc.

963.title: Tax-exempt Income
963.description: Increasing the amount of income that is exempt from the corporate income tax; increasing the amount of income that is exempt from the franchise tax imposed on banks and savings associations, etc.

964.title: Freight Logistics Zones
964.description: Defining the term "freight logistics zone"; authorizing a county, or two or more contiguous counties, to designate a geographic area or areas within its jurisdiction as a freight logistics zone; requiring the adoption of a strategic plan that must include certain information; providing that certain projects within freight logistics zones may be eligible for priority in state funding and certain incentive programs; providing evaluation criteria for freight logistics zones, etc.

970.title: DNA Evidence
970.description: Creating the "Sentencing Procedures Applying Reasonable Evidence (SPARE) Act"; requiring the state to administer a DNA test before imposing the death penalty on a convicted felon; providing exceptions, etc.

974.title: Motor Vehicle and Mobile Home Taxes, Fees, and Surcharges
974.description: Reducing the amount of the additional registration fee used to fund the Florida Real Time Vehicle Information System; reducing the service charge imposed on an application for an original or duplicate license plate, or specified registration stickers or certificates; reducing surcharges imposed on a license tax; reenacting and amending provisions relating to special vehicle license plates for the Governor and federal and state legislators, to incorporate the amendment made to s. 320.06, F.S., in a reference thereto, etc.

978.title: Court-ordered Expunction of Criminal History Records
978.description: Requiring the Department of Law Enforcement to disclose the contents of an expunged criminal history record to the subject of the record or the Parole Commission under certain circumstances, etc.

979.title: Neighborhood Vehicles
979.description: Authorizing the operation of a neighborhood vehicle on certain roads with certain restrictions; providing that a neighborhood vehicle is subject to the same license tax as an electric vehicle or a low-speed vehicle; requiring the Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles to issue a license plate for a neighborhood vehicle upon payment of certain fees and taxes; requiring the department to issue a decal to the owner or lessee of a registered low-speed vehicle or neighborhood vehicle; requiring that the decal be clearly displayed, etc.

980.title: Disabled Parking Permits
980.description: Prohibiting the Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles from requiring an applicant who has been previously certified as permanently disabled to resubmit a certificate of disability for renewal of a disabled parking permit, etc.

986.title: Vehicle Tracking
986.description: Providing that a specified use of a tracking device satisfies the element of "willfully following" for the purposes of the crime of stalking; prohibiting a person from installing a tracking device on a vehicle without the informed consent of the owner; providing a criminal penalty; providing an exception for a law enforcement officer or governmental entity in certain circumstances, etc.

987.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 526 (Ch. 2014-4)
987.title: Child Pornography
987.description: Defining the terms "child pornography" and "minor"; including possession of child pornography within specified criminal offenses; prohibiting certain conditional releasees, probationers, or community controllees from viewing, accessing, owning, or possessing any obscene, pornographic, or sexually stimulating material, etc.

989.last_action: Died in Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
989.title: Self-administration of Medications in Assisted Living Facilities
989.description: Revising criteria for assistance with self-administration of medication, etc.

995.title: Legislative Relief Acts
995.description: Deleting provisions requiring public notice of relief acts; repealing provisions relating to the presentation of claims for relief to the Legislature; deleting a provision authorizing a person entitled to payment on a state obligation to petition the Legislature for payment if such obligation becomes unenforceable under law; deleting a provision authorizing a tort claimant to present claims or judgments in excess of the limited waiver of sovereign immunity to the Legislature for payment, etc.

1006.last_action: Died in Governmental Oversight and Accountability, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7073 (Ch. 2014-221)
1006.title: State Technology
1006.description: Creating the Department of State Technology; requiring the department to develop a long-range plan; establishing the Fletcher Shared Resource Center within the Department of Financial Services to provide enterprise information technology services to the department, to provide colocation services to the Department of Legal Services and the Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services, and to host the Legislative Appropriations System/Planning and Budgeting Subsystem; authorizing the Department of Legal Affairs and the Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services to move data center equipment to the center, etc.

1008.title: Public Records/Automated License Plate Recognition Systems Exemption
1008.description: Creating a public records exemption for certain images and data obtained through the use of an automated license plate recognition system and personal identifying information of an individual in data generated from such images; providing conditions for disclosure of such images and information, etc.

1009.title: Florida Hurricane Catastrophe Fund
1009.description: Revising requirements for reimbursement contracts; revising provisions relating to times and circumstances wherein the State Board of Administration publishes certain statements and notices relating to the fund; requiring the board to negotiate a line of credit to reimburse insurers under certain circumstances; deleting a requirement that the formula for determining premiums to be paid to the fund include a cash build-up factor, etc.

1011.last_action: Died in Education, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 188 (Ch. 2014-41)
1011.title: Biometric Information
1011.description: Prohibiting a school district or school from collecting a student's biometric information, etc.

1014.title: Public Records/Names of Spouses and Children of Public Defenders and Criminal Conflict and Civil Regional Counsel
1014.description: Creating an exemption from public records requirements for the names of the spouses and children of current or former public defenders, assistant public defenders, criminal conflict and civil regional counsel, and assistant criminal conflict and civil regional counsel; providing for future review and repeal of the exemption; providing a statement of necessity, etc.

1016.title: Security of a Protected Consumer's Information
1016.description: Citing this act as the "Keeping I.D. Safe (KIDS) Act"; authorizing the representative of a protected consumer to place a security freeze on a protected consumer's consumer report or record; prohibiting a consumer reporting agency from stating or implying that a security freeze reflects a negative credit history or rating; requiring a consumer reporting agency to remove a security freeze under specified conditions, etc.

1019.title: Assisted Living Facilities
1019.description: Providing that Medicaid managed care plans are responsible for enrolled mental health residents; providing that managing entities under contract with the Department of Children and Families are responsible for mental health residents who are not enrolled with a Medicaid managed care plan; revising the requirement that an extended congregate care license be issued to certain facilities that have been licensed as assisted living facilities under certain circumstances and authorizing the issuance of such license if a specified condition is met, etc.

1023.title: Public Records/Forensic Behavioral Health Evaluation
1023.description: Creating an exemption from public records requirements for a forensic behavioral health evaluation filed with a court; providing retroactive application; providing a statement of public necessity, etc.

1025.title: Unaccompanied Homeless Youths
1025.description: Defining the term "unaccompanied homeless youth"; providing for a certification; authorizing certain unaccompanied homeless youths to consent to medical, dental, psychological, substance abuse, and surgical diagnosis and treatment, and forensic medical examinations for themselves and for their children in certain circumstances; providing that such consent does not affect the requirements of the Parental Notice of Abortion Act, etc.

1027.title: Inflation and Deflation
1027.description: Requiring each state agency, including the judicial branch, to identify all statutes relating to the agency which contain a reference to a monetary amount; requiring each state agency to submit an initial report relating to those findings and make recommendations to the Governor and Legislature by a certain date as to whether those amounts should be adjusted; requiring each agency to submit a final report containing final recommendations to the Governor and Legislature by a certain date and include a fiscal impact statement for each recommended statutory change to the monetary amount, etc.

1028.title: Communications Services Taxes
1028.description: Reducing the tax rate applied to the sale of communications services; reducing the tax rate applied to the retail sale of direct-to-home satellite services; conforming rates to the reduction of the communications services tax; revising the distribution of tax revenues received, etc.

1031.title: Water Utilities
1031.description: Authorizing the Florida Public Service Commission to revoke a certificate of authorization upon receipt of a petition; requiring the commission to consider the quality of water service when fixing rates; requiring the utility to meet with its customers to discuss the costs and benefits of plausible solutions if the commission finds that the utility has failed to meet certain quality of water standards; prohibiting a customer from petitioning the commission to revoke the certificate of authorization of a utility under certain circumstances; authorizing the commission to prescribe penalties for certain failures of the utility, etc.

1035.title: Public Records/Participants in Treatment-based Drug Court Programs
1035.description: Exempting from public records requirements information from the screenings for participation in a treatment-based drug court program, substance abuse screenings, behavioral health evaluations, and subsequent treatment status reports regarding a participant or a person considered for participation in a treatment-based program; providing for exceptions to the exemption; providing for retroactive application of the public record exemption; providing for future repeal and legislative review of the exemption under the Open Government Sunset Review Act; providing a statement of public necessity, etc.

1037.title: Student Eligibility for Interscholastic Athletic Competition
1037.description: Revising requirements for the bylaws of the Florida High School Athletic Association governing student eligibility to participate in interscholastic athletic competition to mandate that the required medical evaluation include an electrocardiogram; revising the information that must be included on the preparticipation physical evaluation form, etc.

1039.title: Underground Facility Damage Prevention and Safety
1039.description: Requiring all member operators including those with state-owned underground facilities located within the right-of-way of a state highway to be notified through the free-access notification system of a proposed excavation or demolition; creating an additional noncriminal infraction for the failure of an excavator to notify the member operator in certain circumstances; requiring an excavator to provide notice through the free-access notification system before beginning certain excavations, demolitions, or maintenance activities, etc.

1041.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 177 (Ch. 2014-197), CS/CS/HB 175 (Ch. 2014-196)
1041.title: Public Records/Wireless Service Provider/Department of Revenue
1041.description: Providing an exemption from public records requirements for proprietary confidential business information submitted by a wireless service provider to the Department of Revenue; authorizing the Department of Revenue to share such information with the Secretary of Management Services and the E911 Board; providing for future legislative review and repeal; providing a statement of public necessity, etc.

1042.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 175 (Ch. 2014-196), CS/HB 177 (Ch. 2014-197)
1042.title: Emergency Communication Systems
1042.description: Revising provisions relating to oversight of certain fees by the Technology Program within the Department of Management Services; revising provisions for administration, distribution, and use of the E911 fee; providing that fees collected may not be included in the base for measuring any tax, fee, surcharge, or other charge; providing that the Department of Revenue is the agent for the E911 Board for purposes of collecting the prepaid wireless E911 fee; revising provisions for accounting, distribution, use, and auditing of the Emergency Communications Number E911 System Fund, etc.

1043.title: Carrying a Concealed Weapon or a Concealed Firearm
1043.description: Providing an exemption from criminal penalties for carrying a concealed weapon or a concealed firearm while in the act of complying with a mandatory evacuation order during a declared state of emergency, etc.

1046.title: Driver Licenses and Driving Privileges
1046.description: Citing this act as the "Driver Accountability Act"; providing a criminal penalty payment alternative if a court finds that the violator has demonstrable financial hardship; amending provisions relating to driving while a license is suspended, revoked, canceled, or disqualified; revising provisions for the Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles to suspend the license of a person who has failed to pay a financial obligation for a criminal offense, etc.

1054.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 115 (Ch. 2014-27)
1054.title: Public Meetings/University Direct-support Organization
1054.description: Providing an exemption from public meeting requirements for any portion of a meeting of the board of directors of a university direct-support organization, or of the executive committee or other committees of such board, at which any proposal seeking research funding from the organization or a plan or program for either initiating or supporting research is discussed; providing for review and repeal of the exemption; providing a statement of public necessity, etc.

1056.title: Use of Wireless Communications Devices while Driving
1056.description: Removing provisions that limit law enforcement of the Florida Ban on Texting While Driving Law to a secondary action, etc.

1057.title: Employment Practices
1057.description: Prohibiting an employer from using a job applicant's credit report or credit history to make certain hiring, compensation, or other employment decisions; providing specific situations in which an employer may use such information; providing exemptions for certain types of employers; providing remedies for an aggrieved person; providing for the award of actual damages and court costs; providing for a plaintiff to post a bond to indemnify the defendant for damages, including attorney fees, in certain situations, etc.

1069.title: Public Records/Yellow Dot Critical Motorist Medical Information Program
1069.description: Providing an exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information of participants in a yellow dot critical motorist medical information program; providing for future legislative review and repeal of the exemption; providing a statement of public necessity, etc.

1070.title: Use of Wireless Communications Devices
1070.description: Prohibiting a person younger than 18 years of age from operating a motor vehicle while using a wireless communications device; defining the term "wireless communications device" and including cellular telephones within that definition for purposes of the act, etc.

1072.title: Regulation of Public Lodging Establishments and Public Food Service Establishments
1072.description: Revising the permitted scope of local laws, ordinances, and regulations regarding vacation rentals, etc.

1074.title: Sentencing for Controlled Substance Violations
1074.description: Providing that a person who knowingly sells, purchases, manufactures, delivers, or brings into this state, or who is knowingly in actual or constructive possession of, specified quantities of hydrocodone, or any salt, derivative, isomer, or salt of an isomer thereof, or any mixture containing any such substance, commits the offense of trafficking in hydrocodone; providing that a person who knowingly sells, purchases, manufactures, delivers, or brings into this state, or who is knowingly in actual or constructive possession of, specified quantities of oxycodone, or any salt, derivative, isomer, or salt of an isomer thereof, or any mixture containing any such substance, commits the offense of trafficking in oxycodone, etc.

1077.last_action: Chapter No. 2014-177, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 641 (Ch. 2014-208)
1077.title: Public Records/Trade Secrets/Computers
1077.description: Amending an exemption from public records requirements for data, programs, and supporting documentation that are trade secrets residing or existing internal or external to a computer, computer system, or computer network; expanding the exemption to include such trade secret information residing or existing internal or external to an electronic device; providing for legislative review and repeal of the exemption; providing a statement of public necessity, etc.

1078.last_action: Died in Governmental Oversight and Accountability
1078.title: Public Records and Public Meetings Exemptions
1078.description: Eliminating requirements that the closed portion of a meeting of the State Child Abuse Death Review Committee or a local committee at which specified identifying information is discussed be recorded, and that no portion of such meeting be off the record, etc.

1082.title: Discounts on Public Facility Fees and Fares
1082.description: Requiring counties and municipalities to provide partial or full discounts on park entrance fees to military members, veterans, and the spouses and parents of certain deceased military members, law enforcement officers, and firefighters; requiring that individuals seeking the discount present written documentation satisfactory to the county which evidences eligibility; requiring regional transportation authorities to provide partial or full discounts on fares and on other charges for certain disabled veterans, etc.

1083.title: Responsibilities of Health Care Facilities
1083.description: Repealing provisions relating to provider hospitals; prohibiting a health care facility from employing or contracting with a surgical assistant or surgical technologist under certain circumstances; providing exceptions; requiring a hospital to notify obstetrical physicians before the hospital closes its obstetrical department or ceases to provide obstetrical services, etc.

1085.title: Application of Foreign Law in Courts
1085.description: Defining the term "strong public policy"; prohibiting a court from enforcing certain choice of law or forum selection contractual provisions; requiring a court to review judgments and orders of foreign courts for comity before enforcing such orders or judgments; specifying judgments and orders of foreign courts that are not entitled to comity; providing that the attempt to apply the law of a foreign country is void under certain circumstances; prohibiting a trial court from dismissing an action on the grounds that a satisfactory remedy may be more conveniently sought in a foreign country; providing an exception, etc.

1087.title: Public Records/Identifying Information of Personnel of Department of Health
1087.description: Providing an exemption from public records requirements for certain identifying information of specific current and former personnel of the Department of Health and the spouses and children of such personnel, under specified circumstances; providing for future legislative review and repeal of the exemption under the Open Government Sunset Review Act; providing a statement of public necessity, etc.

1089.title: Licensing of Facilities that offer Health and Human Services
1089.description: Requiring a family day care home to conspicuously display its license or registration in the common area of the home, to provide proof of a written plan that identifies a designated substitute for the operator, and to provide proof of screening and background checks for certain individuals; prohibiting the advertising of a child care facility, family day care home, or large family day care home unless it is licensed or registered, etc.

1090.title: Joint Use and Public Access of Public School Facilities and Joint Community Projects
1090.description: Authorizing district school boards to enter into joint-use agreements with a local government or a private organization or adopt public access policies; authorizing a district school board to enter into agreements with a county, municipality, or Florida College System institution to develop and operate joint community projects; authorizing certain provisions to be included in joint-use agreements for joint community projects, including indemnification of district school boards and liability insurance, etc.

1099.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 993 (Ch. 2014-37)
1099.title: Public Records/Animal Researchers
1099.description: Providing an exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information of certain animal researchers at public research facilities, including state universities; providing for retroactive applicability of the exemption; providing for future legislative review and repeal of the exemption; providing a statement of public necessity, etc.

1101.last_action: Died in Military and Veterans Affairs, Space, and Domestic Security, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7015 (Ch. 2014-1)
1101.title: Fee Waivers for Military Veterans
1101.description: Increasing the amount of time available for a military veteran to apply to the Department of Business and Professional Regulation for certain licenses without paying initial fees, etc.

1103.title: Renter Insurance
1103.description: Requiring a residential rental agreement to specify whether renter insurance is required and specifying provisions that must be included if insurance is or is not required, etc.

1109.last_action: Died in Appropriations Subcommittee on Health and Human Services
1109.title: Payment for Services Provided by Licensed Psychologists
